finding: The SNP rs63750082 (p.Gly206Ala) was identified in a pair of siblings within the ADSP Family study, indicating its potential relevance to familial Alzheimer's disease.
title: Frequency of Variants in Mendelian Alzheimer’s Disease Genes within the Alzheimer’s Disease Sequencing Project (ADSP)

finding: The SNP rs63749824 (p.Ala79Val) was one of the two variants identified as contributing to the high carrier rate of clinical variants in PSEN1 among AD cases.
title: Frequency of Variants in Mendelian Alzheimer’s Disease Genes within the Alzheimer’s Disease Sequencing Project (ADSP)

finding: Variant rs7141210 demonstrated a maternal-specific association with platelet counts, replicating previously reported findings. This variant was associated with a DNA methylation pattern that indicated the maternally inherited allele could impair maternal gene expression at the paternally expressed DLK1 gene.
title: Genome-wide survey of parent-of-origin specific associations across clinical traits derived from electronic health records

finding: In SOS2, the missense variant rs72681869 correlated with higher lung function measures (FVC, FEV1) and was associated with multiple metabolic parameters in the PheWAS, highlighting its potential metabolic implications.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide association study improves resolution of genes, pathways and pleiotropy for lung function and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease

finding: The SNP rs1754680 had significant associations with obesity among European ancestry participants, though no positive findings were reported for other ancestry populations.
title: A Phenome-Wide Association Study of genes associated with COVID-19 severity reveals shared genetics with complex diseases in the Million Veteran Program

finding: The SNP rs4608241 was associated with high severity COVID-19 in individuals with Oceanian ancestry, mapped to chromosome 14 (14:44073392-44149995) with a p-value of 1.2e-07 after correction. This finding was derived from the same genome-wide interaction analysis that included pathological hallmarks of Alzheimer's disease, highlighting its significance.
title: Deconvoluting complex correlates of COVID19 severity with local ancestry inference and viral phylodynamics: Results of a multiomic pandemic tracking strategy

finding: Found to be in moderate LD (R2=0.26) with a 310 bp deletion overlapping an enhancer element in the IGH gene cluster, indicating the potential relevance of structural variation in Alzheimer's risk connected to immune regulation.
title: Structural Variation Detection and Association Analysis of Whole-Genome-Sequence Data from 16,905 Alzheimer’s Diseases Sequencing Project Subjects

finding: The SNP rs11156978 was associated with impaired glucose tolerance in mouse knockouts, indicating its potential role in metabolic traits.
title: The genetic architecture of changes in adiposity during adulthood

finding: rs8017642 was identified as an endothelial cell (EC)-specific caQTL for NEK9, which was expressed in endothelial cells associated with endothelium-to-mesenchymal transition, linking it to CAD.
title: Single cell variant to enhancer to gene map for coronary artery disease

finding: The rs9323567 SNP, located in the intronic region of RGS6 on chromosome 14q24.2, was associated with a reduced PRU value, presenting a beta of -26.71, a confidence interval from -37.27 to -16.15, and a p-value of 9.85×10^-7. This finding was relevant to the therapeutic implications in patients with cardiac issues.
title: Discovery of Ancestry-specific Variants Associated with Clopidogrel Response among Caribbean Hispanics

finding: Associated with <italic>SLC25A21</italic>, this variant emphasized its importance in the broader understanding of PSA metrics.
title: Leveraging Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Towards Improving Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: The Z allele at SNP rs28929474 (SERPINA1) was examined under both additive and recessive genetic models, revealing differing patterns of association and opposite estimated effect directions on forced expiratory volume in 1 second (FEV1) and forced vital capacity (FVC), consistent with previous findings reported by Fawcett et al. (2021).
title: DeepPheWAS: an R package for phenotype generation and association analysis for phenome-wide association studies

finding: The rs187319135 variant located upstream of the TCL1B locus was associated with an increased risk of overall CH (OR: 1.85 [1.53-2.23], P = 2.69 x 10^-9) and gene-specific CH, particularly TET2 and SF3B1 plus SRSF2 associated CH, indicating its potential role in CH development.
title: Comparative analysis of 136,401 Admixed Americans and 419,228 Europeans reveals ancestry-specific genetic determinants of clonal haematopoiesis

finding: The rs774615666 promoter variant of the TCL1B locus was associated with significantly increased risks for TET2-CH (OR = 4.19 [2.89-6.06], P = 2.77 x 10^-10) and SF3B1 plus SRSF2-CH (OR = 16.7 [9.53-29.4], P = 9.15 x 10^-13). This variant showed a strong effect in Indigenous American ancestry.
title: Comparative analysis of 136,401 Admixed Americans and 419,228 Europeans reveals ancestry-specific genetic determinants of clonal haematopoiesis

finding: The rs968294563 variant, identified as a low-frequency variant located upstream of TCL1B, was found to be in strong linkage disequilibrium with rs187319135 and contributed to an increased risk of overall CH.
title: Comparative analysis of 136,401 Admixed Americans and 419,228 Europeans reveals ancestry-specific genetic determinants of clonal haematopoiesis

finding: associated with LINC00637, further elucidating the genetic factors involved in addiction.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association meta-analysis of over 1 million subjects identifies loci underlying multiple substance use disorders

finding: The pathogenic PiZ allele rs28929474 was shown to have a protective effect against AMD with an OR of 0.81, indicating its potential usefulness in understanding AMD risk.
title: Distinctive cross-ancestry genetic architecture for age-related macular degeneration

finding: The risk allele rs17580 corresponding to the PiS allele was associated with an increased risk for AMD (OR = 1.10), highlighting its negative impact.
title: Distinctive cross-ancestry genetic architecture for age-related macular degeneration

finding: The SNP <italic>rs4904871</italic> was connected to hair color variation, displaying effects across ancestry groups that signify cross-population genetic heterogeneity.
title: Inter-population differences of allele frequency and regulome tagging are associated with the heterogeneity of loci identified by cross-ancestry genome-wide association studies

finding: The SNP was associated with pituitary gland volume (β = 0.06) and has been previously related to testosterone and age at menarche, illustrating its involvement in reproductive endocrine regulation.
title: Genome-wide analysis identifies 66 variants underlying anatomical variation in human neuroendocrine structures and reveals links to testosterone

finding: The rs12882923 variant was identified as a top-ranked variant in prostate cancer risk, mapping to a POL2RA binding site and a DNA motif of multiple transcription factors in prostate epithelium, suggesting significant functional implications.
title: GWAS and 3D chromatin mapping identifies multicancer risk genes associated with hormone-dependent cancers

finding: The rs2236007 risk g-allele was found to reduce PAX9 promoter activity through recruitment of the suppressive transcription factor EGR1, which led to increased breast cancer cell growth, illustrating its role in breast cancer susceptibility.
title: GWAS and 3D chromatin mapping identifies multicancer risk genes associated with hormone-dependent cancers

finding: The SLC24A4:rs12881735-C variant was categorized as protective and analyzed in the context of Alzheimer's disease.
title: Biobank-scale characterization of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias identifies potential disease-causing variants, risk factors, and genetic modifiers across diverse ancestries

finding: The variant rs28929474 in SERPINA1 gene had a PIP of 0.64, and was associated with multiple diseases beyond migraine.
title: Fine-mapping a genome-wide meta-analysis of 98,374 migraine cases identifies 181 sets of candidate causal variants

finding: This SNP was identified as a known pathogenic missense variant located in SERPINA1, suggesting its impact on VTE risk through protein dysfunction.
title: Cross-Ancestry Investigation of Venous Thromboembolism Genomic Predictors

finding: The rs17580 variant within the SERPINA1 gene was characterized as a rare missense variant with a high CADD PHRED score of 32. SERPINA1 has implications in inflammatory pathways and direct interactions with fibrinogen, suggesting a noteworthy association with fibrinogen levels in relation to coagulation processes.
title: Whole genome analysis of plasma fibrinogen reveals population-differentiated genetic regulators with putative liver roles

finding: The variant rs9671760 was significantly associated with antibody reactivity against the rubella virus (P = 3.34 × 10^-14) and the sandfly fever Sicilian virus (P = 1.46 × 10^-11). This variant was noted to regulate IGHV3-64 usage, which is instrumental in antibody response quality.
title: Demographic and genetic factors shape the epitope specificity of the human antibody repertoire against viruses

finding: The variant rs1024350 showed a significant association with antibodies against the rubella virus (P = 1.90 × 10^-11) and was suggestively associated with influenza A virus (IAV) antibodies (P = 5.38 × 10^-10). This variant affects IGHV1-69 usage, which plays a critical role in determining the quality of anti-influenza antibodies.
title: Demographic and genetic factors shape the epitope specificity of the human antibody repertoire against viruses

finding: The variant was associated with mitral valve prolapse and was found to overlap an enhancer that regulates the gene LTBP2 in all valvular interstitial cell (VIC) populations. It was predicted to create a composite GATA/TAL motif instance, suggesting its substantial involvement in affecting valve structure by tuning the expression of CHD genes.
title: Molecular convergence of risk variants for congenital heart defects leveraging a regulatory map of the human fetal heart

finding: The SNP rs57731447 was identified as a candidate mediator in the phenome-wide association study (PheWAS) evaluating the protein levels of ENTPD5. The two-step Mendelian randomization (MR) determined that the protein level associated with this SNP had confirmed causal effects on four candidate mediators relevant to COVID-19 severity, highlighting its role in host responses.
title: Multi-omics study revealing putative drug targets of COVID-19 severity and other viral infection diseases

finding: The SNP rs118113209 was selected as a gene expression instrument of ENTPD5 in the analysis of mediators linking ENTPD5 with COVID-19 severity. The findings from the two-step MR demonstrated a causal effect of ENTPD5 gene expression associated with this SNP on multiple candidate mediators, implicating it in the molecular mechanisms related to COVID-19 severity.
title: Multi-omics study revealing putative drug targets of COVID-19 severity and other viral infection diseases

finding: The lead GWAS SNP rs10143310, while just below genome-wide significance for ALS in a European context, was associated with splicing of introns in the ATXN3 gene, following the pattern observed in C9orf72. The SNP correlated with an increase in risk due to intermediate lengths of the CAG repeat associated with ALS.
title: Integrative genetic analysis of the amyotrophic lateral sclerosis spinal cord implicates glial activation and suggests new risk genes

finding: The lead QTL SNP rs200388434 was found to be in high linkage disequilibrium with rs10143310 and was associated with the splicing of multiple introns at the 3' end of the ATXN3 gene. This finding implicated it in the ALS risk pathway through potential intermediate CAG repeat expansion.
title: Integrative genetic analysis of the amyotrophic lateral sclerosis spinal cord implicates glial activation and suggests new risk genes

finding: The lead variant at TCL1A was rs2887399, identified as a primary mediator of clonal expansion in CHIP carriers. It was implicated in clonal hematopoiesis (CH) by influencing chromatin accessibility and thus the expression of the proto-oncogene TCL1A.
title: The Genetic Determinants and Genomic Consequences of Non-Leukemogenic Somatic Point Mutations

finding: Fine-mapping revealed that rs11846938 was in high linkage disequilibrium with rs2887399 and both variants were part of a causal signal affecting TCL1A expression, suggesting alterations in mutation burden are linked to these variants.
title: The Genetic Determinants and Genomic Consequences of Non-Leukemogenic Somatic Point Mutations

finding: The variant rs2295848 was a novel locus identified linked to retinal fractal dimension (D<sub>f</sub>), located in or near the DAAM1 gene. It showed a genome-wide significant association (P-Value = 1.41 x 10<sup>-9</sup>), contributing to understanding the genetic mechanisms linking retinal D<sub>f</sub> to aging and cardiometabolic diseases.
title: Proteome-wide Mendelian randomization study implicates inflammaging biomarkers in retinal vasculature, cardiometabolic diseases and longevity

finding: For the SNP rs28929474, associations were assessed using both additive and recessive models. The analysis showed differing association patterns, including opposite direction effects on forced expiratory volume in 1 second (FEV1) and forced vital capacity (FVC), consistent with previous findings.
title: Deep-PheWAS: a pipeline for phenotype generation and association analysis for phenome-wide association studies

finding: The SNP rs60820638 at the CEBPE locus exhibited a significant association with ALL (P=5.38 x 10^-8) representing a novel association not previously reported.
title: Genome-wide trans-ethnic meta-analysis identifies novel susceptibility loci for childhood acute lymphoblastic leukemia

finding: The SNP rs11158314 was concurrently associated with both prostate cancer risk and the expression level of SNAPC1e.
title: Enhancer RNA transcriptome-wide association study reveals an atlas of pan-cancer susceptibility eRNAs

finding: This missense variant in SOS2 correlated with SHBG levels and showed associations with various metabolic traits.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide association study improves resolution of genes, pathways and pleiotropy for lung function and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease

finding: The SNP rs1957862 was identified as an ASD susceptibility locus found in nearly 1/3 of individuals in the Miami and AGPC cohorts. This SNP is located in the LRFN5 gene, which is implicated in synaptic development. Moreover, the variant was shown to be differentially marked with H3K9me3 in male individuals with autism when inherited maternally, linking it directly to the neurodevelopmental processes associated with autism.
title: Maintenance of Heterochromatin links Chromatin Modifiers and Neurodevelopment in Autism Spectrum Disorder

finding: The SNP rs2268458 in the TSHR gene showed that patients with the CC genotype had a higher risk of relapse compared to those with the TT genotype, indicating its relevance in predicting Graves' disease recurrence.
title: Outcome of Graves’ Disease and Associated Genetic Predisposition: A Systematic Review of Literature

finding: SNP rs1122138, located in an intronic region of TCL1A, demonstrated genome-wide significance with a p-value of 3.1×10−8, correlating with clonal expansion of mCAs; however, it lost significance when adjusted for the closely linked rs2887399.
title: Determinants of mosaic chromosomal alteration fitness

finding: SNP rs2887399 was previously associated with clonal expansion and demonstrated significant correlation with PACER, indicating its role in mCA dynamics, alongside rs1122138.
title: Determinants of mosaic chromosomal alteration fitness

finding: This SNP downstream of PPM1A was associated with pituitary gland volume (β = -0.06, SE = 0.01) and had previous associations to testosterone and reproductive timing.
title: Genome-wide analysis identifies 66 variants underlying anatomical variation in human neuroendocrine structures and reveals links to testosterone

finding: The SNP rs7155889 in the TRAF3 gene was identified as a shared locus, highlighting its significance in the context of anxiety and other psychiatric disorders.
title: Identification of Novel Genomic Loci for Anxiety and Extensive Genetic Overlap with Psychiatric Disorders

finding: The rs179247 SNP located in the TSHR gene indicated a higher risk of thyroid disorders with an associated RAF of 0.8125 in cases versus 0.75 in controls. The OR was calculated at 1.444, reflecting a significant association with increased risk, particularly highlighting the link to Graves’ disease in the studied population.
title: SNP Genes Effect on Thyroid Disorders in a Chinese Demographic

finding: The rs117800773 V1506M mutation within the LTBP2 gene exhibited segregation with the Mitral Valve Prolapse (MVP) trait in a large pedigree study, indicating that this mutation is associated with the disorder. Both knockout (KO) and knock-in (KI) mouse models demonstrated high prevalence of myxomatous degeneration as characterized by echocardiographic and histological analyses. Statistically significant differences were shown between KO and wild-type controls, confirming the causative role of the LTBP2 mutation in MVP.
title: Characterization of LTBP2 mutation causing Mitral Valve Prolapse

finding: The missense variant rs28929474 in SERPINA1 was associated with N-acetylglucosaminylasparagine levels and linked to cholestasis of pregnancy risk.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: The GSTZ1 variant was associated with maleate levels, relevant to detoxification processes.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: This L2HGDH variant was associated with 2-hydroxyglutarate levels, implicating its metabolic activity in the citric acid cycle.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: The SNP rs117689036 showed a significant association with gestational diabetes (OR = 3.15, P = 1.46×10^-8) and is located in the MDGA2 gene, which is associated with glycosylphosphatidylinositol anchor regulation.
title: Genetic Polymorphisms Associated with Adverse Pregnancy Outcomes in Nulliparas

finding: Found to be linked to TSH levels, rs2160215's association with the thyrotropin receptor gene emphasized its relevance in thyroid regulation.
title: Genome-wide association studies in a large Korean cohort identify novel quantitative trait loci for 36 traits and illuminates their genetic architectures

finding: In the leave-one-out analyses, excluding rs2693698 produced a statistically significant causal effect estimate on bipolar disorder (BD), with results indicating a beta of 0.029 and a p-value of 0.046. This suggested that rs2693698 had a notable association with the impact of BD on poverty.
title: The impact of poverty on mental illness: Emerging evidence of a causal relationship

finding: The SNP rs10131280 at the IGH gene cluster locus was confirmed as a risk factor in this study, providing independent validation from European ancestry findings.
title: First GWAS on Alzheimer’s Disease in Argentina and Chile populations

finding: The SNP rs63750082, a known early-onset AD causal mutation in PSEN1, although ultra-rare, was reported in 16 individuals with AD among the Hispanic population.
title: Association of Common and Rare Variants with Alzheimer’s Disease in over 13,000 Diverse Individuals with Whole-Genome Sequencing from the Alzheimer’s Disease Sequencing Project

finding: This SNP was part of the eQTL analysis for the FUT8 gene, with a highly significant association indicating its potential regulatory role in glycosylation.
title: Exome sequencing reveals aggregates of rare variants in glycosyltransferase and other genes influencing immunoglobulin G and transferrin glycosylation

finding: The study found that the Pi*Z allele (rs28929474) in the SERPINA1 gene was the most common cause of severe Alpha-1-antitrypsin deficiency (A1ATD), which is a genetic disorder associated with early-onset emphysema, liver disease, and auto-inflammatory conditions. Although the penetrance of this variant was noted to be incomplete, its impact on disease severity was further explored through the cryptic phenotype analysis, indicating that environmental factors and common genetic modifiers likely influenced clinical outcomes in patients with A1ATD.
title: Common genetic variation associated with Mendelian disease severity revealed through cryptic phenotype analysis

finding: This SNP was identified as a lead variant in heart failure (HF) studies and was found to have a significant association with HF, being part of the 89% of the variants confirmed at genome-wide significance.
title: Common- and rare-variant genetic architecture of heart failure across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: The SNP rs28929474 in SERPINA1 showed significant association with reduced VAT/GFAT ratio (beta = -0.16; P = 4.8 x 10^-10), previously linked to liver disease.
title: Inherited basis of visceral, abdominal subcutaneous and gluteofemoral fat depots

finding: The variant rs2664299 was connected to volume of the left thalamus proper in relation to snoring, reinforcing insights into sleep genetics.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: At the TCL1A locus, rs11846938 was identified as a causal variant in five credible sets with a high posterior inclusion probability (PIP > 0.98) and was noted to be in very high linkage disequilibrium (LD) with rs2887399. This SNP was associated with the upregulation of the TCL1A gene, a primary mediator of clonal expansion in CHIP carriers.
title: The Genetic Determinants and Genomic Consequences of Non-Leukemogenic Somatic Point Mutations

finding: rs2887399 was previously discovered as a primary mediator of clonal expansion in CHIP carriers and is linked to aberrant chromatin accessibility that may enhance the activation of the TCL1A oncogene, connected to clonal hematopoiesis.
title: The Genetic Determinants and Genomic Consequences of Non-Leukemogenic Somatic Point Mutations

finding: This SNP was identified in the fine-mapping of the TCL1A locus, located 9kb upstream, suggesting its involvement in the regulatory mechanisms impacting mutation burden.
title: The Genetic Determinants and Genomic Consequences of Non-Leukemogenic Somatic Point Mutations

finding: As one of the causal variants at the TCL1A locus, rs1080435 contributed to the regulation of the TCL1A gene implicated in clonal expansion mechanisms in hematopoietic stem cells.
title: The Genetic Determinants and Genomic Consequences of Non-Leukemogenic Somatic Point Mutations

finding: This SNP was part of the credible set for the TCL1A locus, contributing to the mutational landscape associated with clonal hematopoiesis.
title: The Genetic Determinants and Genomic Consequences of Non-Leukemogenic Somatic Point Mutations

finding: Identified in the fine-mapping at the TCL1A locus, rs73350164 was determined to influence hematopoietic outcomes through its association with TCL1A expression.
title: The Genetic Determinants and Genomic Consequences of Non-Leukemogenic Somatic Point Mutations

finding: The SNP rs73347525 was identified as the candidate causal SNP for the HbA1c signal, with the A allele increasing enhancer probability and significantly associated with T2D and elevated glucose levels, likely by perturbing ZNF415 binding.
title: Modeling islet enhancers using deep learning identifies candidate causal variants at loci associated with T2D and glycemic traits

finding: This SNP was linked to idelalisib response with significant association (p=4.20 x 10^-7). It is positioned upstream in the SLC38A6 gene, associated with glutamine and glutamate transport, indicating that SLC38A6 could be critical for the transport of idelalisib or its substrates in AML.
title: Exome-wide association study reveals 7 functional variants associated with ex-vivo drug response in acute myeloid leukemia patients

finding: This SNP, located upstream of SEL1L and within a transcription factor binding site cluster, was identified with a meta-analysis P-value of 0.011, demonstrating a consistent association with Alzheimer's disease (AD) across both discovery and replication datasets.
title: Whole-genome sequencing reveals new Alzheimer’s disease-associated rare variants in loci related to synaptic function and neuronal development

finding: An intronic variant within GPR132, this SNP demonstrated consistent effects across major ancestries and is linked with immune regulation in atopic dermatitis.
title: European and multi-ancestry genome-wide association meta-analysis of atopic dermatitis highlights importance of systemic immune regulation

finding: This SNP exhibited significant association with PSA levels, contributing to understanding genetic risk factors.
title: Genetically Adjusted PSA Levels for Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: The missense variant rs365990 in the MYH6 gene was associated with spatial strainrad in the basal lateral wall, although it did not show associations with left ventricular mass, ejection fraction, or global strainrad. This study marked its first identification in relation to spatial cardiac traits.
title: Genetic architecture of cardiac structure and function

finding: The rs959388/PRKD1 variant was connected with BMI, smoking, and blood pressure, further suggesting its involvement in the HF phenotype.
title: Genome-wide association analysis and Mendelian randomization proteomics identify novel protein biomarkers and drug targets for primary prevention of heart failure

finding: The SNP rs10220464 was significantly associated with lower percent predicted forced expiratory volume in one second (FEV1) in children from a multiethnic cohort. Specifically, it had a p-value of 2.4×10^-9 and an effect size (βz) of -0.31, indicating that the presence of the minor allele was linked with impaired lung function.
title: Multi-omic association study identifies DNA methylation-mediated genotype and smoking exposure effects on lung function in children living in urban settings

finding: A genome-wide significant AM association at chr14:80425295:CATAA:C was found related to 'Missed abortion/Hydatidiform mole' in HL females, with a significant p-value of p<3.92×10−6 and an odds ratio of 3.11, implicating the DIO2 gene in pregnancy loss risk.
title: Systematic comparison of phenome-wide admixture mapping and genome-wide association in a diverse biobank

finding: The rs2296651 (S267F) variant on NTCP (SLC10A1) was inversely associated with chronic hepatitis B and progression to cirrhosis and hepatocellular carcinoma in patients with chronic hepatitis B, indicating its relevance in liver disease progression.
title: Identification of potential core genes in hepatoblastoma via bioinformatics analysis

finding: The rs1778366 variant was significantly linked to the friend subscale of social isolation, located between LINC02315 and LRFN5 genes. This connection indicated that the genotype could influence feelings of social connection or disconnection, especially relating to depressive symptoms, highlighting an association with neurobehavioral or psychiatric conditions.
title: Genome-wide Association Study of Social Isolation in 63 497 Japanese Individuals from the General Population

finding: The SNP rs7141210 at the DLK1-MEG3 locus was identified as modifying the relationship between sex hormone-binding globulin (SHBG) and mosaic loss of Y-chromosome (LOY). Specifically, the homozygous T/T genotype had a significant interaction effect (P<sub>interaction</sub>=0.04) such that low levels of SHBG were observed specifically in men without LOY, but not in those with LOY.
title: Age-related loss of the Y chromosome is associated with sex hormone binding globulin and selected drivers of clonal hematopoiesis

finding: The SNP rs10220464 was identified as being significantly associated with lower percent predicted forced expiratory volume in one second (FEV1) in a pediatric cohort, with a p-value of 2.4×10^-9 and a beta coefficient of -0.31 (95% CI = -0.41 to -0.21). This association was mediated by DNA methylation levels at the cg03306306 locus in airway epithelial cells.
title: Multi-omic association study implicates PPP1R13B in DNA methylation-mediated genotype and smoking exposure effects on lung function in children living in urban settings

finding: The SNP rs8181938, which was the lead cis-pQTL for MAX, was associated with several body-related traits such as height and forced vital capacity. Mendelian randomization analysis indicated that levels of MAX were likely to affect these traits without reverse causation, thus suggesting a case of vertical pleiotropy.
title: Integrative proteogenomics study identifies the indirect effect of circulating proteins on 8 diseases via telomere length

finding: The SNP rs34354104, identified as the lead cis-pQTL for GMPR2, was linked to body-related traits including mean corpuscular hemoglobin and mean corpuscular volume. MR analysis for this SNP also suggested that GMPR2 levels influenced these traits without reverse causation, supporting the notion of vertical pleiotropy.
title: Integrative proteogenomics study identifies the indirect effect of circulating proteins on 8 diseases via telomere length

finding: The locus associated with rs2887399-T was found to significantly increase the risk for DNMT3A CHIP, with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.19 (95% CI: 1.15-1.23), and demonstrated statistical significance with a p-value of 1.26 x 10^-22.
title: Germline genomic and phenomic landscape of clonal hematopoiesis in 323,112 individuals

finding: The SNP rs4900291-T significantly reduced the risk for TET2 CHIP with an odds ratio (OR) of 0.78 (95% CI: 0.73-0.84) and was statistically significant with a p-value of 2.92 x 10^-11.
title: Germline genomic and phenomic landscape of clonal hematopoiesis in 323,112 individuals

finding: This SNP downstream of PPM1A was linked with pituitary gland volume (β = -0.06) and has associations with testosterone regulation and reproductive timing.
title: Genome-wide analysis identifies 66 variants underlying anatomical variation in human neuroendocrine structures and reveals links to testosterone

finding: The SNP rs941576 was identified as associated with Type 1 Diabetes Mellitus (T1DM) in a Genome-wide Association Study (GWAS). This association supported the role of the 14q32 chromosomal locus in the pathogenesis of T1DM, correlating with the findings that separate individuals into different subgroups based on their circulating microRNA profiles.
title: A set of circulating microRNAs belonging to the 14q32 chromosomic locus identifies two clinically and phenotypically different subgroups of individuals with recent onset Stage 3 type 1 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs2370982, located near NRXN3, was identified as associated with atrial fibrillation and demonstrated overlapping effects with various cardiometabolic traits, implying a connection between cardiometabolic alterations and AF pathogenesis.
title: Deciphering the genetic architecture of atrial fibrillation offers insights into disease prediction, pathophysiology and downstream sequelae

finding: This SNP was located near the SLC38A6 gene and showed strong associations with both kyphosis and lordosis, indicating its critical role in spinal curvature. Additionally, it was identified in colocalization analyses with RNA expression.
title: Aging of the Spine: Characterizing genetic and physiological determinants of spinal curvature

finding: This SNP located within the IFT43 gene was novelly associated with campesterol levels (P=2.64×10^−8), although no prior studies established this association.
title: Genome-Wide Association Study and Meta-Analysis of Phytosterols Identifies a Novel Locus for Serum Levels of Campesterol

finding: The SNP rs10083370 was associated with increased expression of PPP1R13B in the caudate nucleus, particularly with the schizophrenia risk allele G. This suggests that this SNP plays a significant role in the genetic modulation of gene expression associated with schizophrenia.
title: Genetic and environmental regulation of caudate nucleus transcriptome: insight into schizophrenia risk and the dopamine system

finding: In this research, rs945270 correlated with variations in brain shape features, aligning with earlier findings pertaining to brain volume traits.
title: Genetic influences on the shape of brain ventricular and subcortical structures

finding: This SNP was implicated in shape features, supporting earlier associations with cognitive and brain health characteristics.
title: Genetic influences on the shape of brain ventricular and subcortical structures

finding: The rs1884539 polymorphism at the DLK1-DIO3 ICR was analyzed in the context of its association with DNA methylation differences across placental samples from ART, SF, and control groups. The finding suggested that variations at this SNP could influence imprinting stability, particularly related to the expression of the imprinted endocrine signaling molecule DLK1, which is downregulated in ART samples.
title: Genome-wide DNA methylation, imprinting, and gene expression in human placentas derived from Assisted Reproductive Technology

finding: Similar to rs1884539, the rs75998174 polymorphism at the DLK1-DIO3 ICR was identified during the study as another factor involved in the DNA methylation changes seen in ART placentas. This finding also indicated that the SNP might play a role in the altered expression patterns that contribute to imprinting disorders and metabolic features associated with ART.
title: Genome-wide DNA methylation, imprinting, and gene expression in human placentas derived from Assisted Reproductive Technology

finding: For the bone density candidate causal variant rs10130587, osteoblasts were inferred as a high confidence cell type. The bone morphogenetic protein 4 gene (BMP4), implicated in body stature and essential for bone formation and osteoblast differentiation, was identified as the target gene.
title: Inferring causal cell types of human diseases and risk variants from candidate regulatory elements

finding: An association was found for rs4444235 at 14q22.2 with an OR of 1.20 (95% CI: 1.038-1.405, P=0.01451), confirming its relevance in colorectal cancer susceptibility.
title: Colorectal Cancer Risk and Ancestry in Colombian admixed Populations

finding: The PARP2 rs200603922 variant was associated with PrCa risk (p=0.028) specifically in the Australian dataset. The amino acid change (p.R15G) is predicted to alter protein interactions, potentially affecting base excision repair mechanisms.
title: Germline sequencing of DNA-damage-repair genes in two hereditary prostate cancer cohorts reveals new disease risk-associated gene variants

finding: The SNP rs144313315 was identified as a low-frequency stop-gained mutation (p.Arg331Ter) in the TBPL2 gene, showing a significant association with female infertility. The odds ratio was calculated to be 650.1 with a p-value of 4.1×10^-25, indicating a strong correlation with the disease. Women homozygous for this mutation had significantly fewer offspring compared to other genotypes, further supporting its link to fertility issues.
title: Inherited infertility - mapping loci associated with impaired female reproduction

finding: The rs229243 SNP was linked to SCFD1 and prioritized through SMR, indicating regulatory effects on the gene in the context of ALS risk.
title: Common and rare variant association analyses in Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis identify 15 risk loci with distinct genetic architectures and neuron-specific biology

finding: The G allele at rs365990 from the MYH6 gene was associated with a greater survival rate to older age, showing an odds ratio of 1.725. This allele correlated with a decreased heart rate, suggesting lower stress on cardiovascular health and extended lifespan.
title: Genetic variants associated with longevity in long-living Indians

finding: This SNP was identified as significant at a conservative Bonferroni-corrected replication threshold in relation to heart failure, contributing to the genetic understanding of HF risk.
title: Common- and rare-variant genetic architecture of heart failure across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: This SNP showed significant allelic changes in reporter activities within cardiac cells, indicating its potential regulatory function related to atrial fibrillation. It had a high posterior inclusion probability of 0.41 when analyzed under uniform prior.
title: Single-cell genomics improves the discovery of risk variants and genes of Atrial Fibrillation

finding: The variant rs190043928 had an odds ratio of 2.8 (95% CI: 2.0-3.9, p = 1.03 x 10^-8) and was linked with higher HbA1c levels in the context of T2D, particularly in African ancestry.
title: Rare variant association analysis in 51,256 type 2 diabetes cases and 370,487 controls informs the spectrum of pathogenicity of monogenic diabetes genes

finding: The variant rs1132339 in the TNFAIP2 gene was associated with gene expression and helped confirm associations with increased cTnI.
title: Using human genetics to understand the causes and consequences of circulating cardiac troponin I in the general population

finding: The SNP rs56349439, located at chr14:101168739, was identified as having the strongest association with mosaic loss of the Y chromosome (mLOY) across three different methods of analysis, including MosCoverY. It demonstrated the smallest p-value among the identified genetic signals, highlighting its significant relationship to mLOY as observed in the study. This finding contextually relates to the broader implications of mLOY, which is associated with aging and various health conditions.
title: MosCoverY: a new method to estimate mosaic Loss of Y chromosome from NGS sequencing coverage data

finding: At the 14q24.2 locus, the SNP rs244620 had an association with febrile seizures (P = 2.35 × 10^-10, OR = 1.13). This SNP was linked to increased MAP3K9 expression in multiple tissue types, identifying it as relevant in seizure pathways.
title: Genome-wide association study of febrile seizures identifies seven new loci implicating fever response and neuronal excitability genes

finding: The rs959388 variant was associated with BMI, smoking, and blood pressure, indicating its significance in contributing to heart failure risk factors.
title: Genome-wide association analysis and Mendelian randomization proteomics identify novel protein biomarkers and drug targets for primary prevention of heart failure

finding: This SNP was recognized for its significant impact on NAFLD risk through a coding missense variant.
title: A genome-wide association study for nonalcoholic fatty liver disease identifies novel genetic loci and trait-relevant candidate genes in the Million Veteran Program

finding: Identified as the most significant association in European (EUR) ancestry with an odds ratio (OR) of 0.708 and a highly significant p-value of 3.18×10^-419 for mLOY.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide association meta-analysis of mosaic loss of chromosome Y in the Million Veteran Program identifies 167 novel loci

finding: The variant rs1281241634 within a suggestive genomic window (near LINC01500) replicated in the general population for stroke (p-value of 0.03), with another replication noted in the FinnDiane GWAS for the same genomic region.
title: Whole-genome sequencing identifies variants in ANK1, LRRN1, HAS1, and other genes and regulatory regions for stroke in type 1 diabetes

finding: This SNP interacted negatively with rs17425819 and was associated with reduced risk of polycythemia vera among those with the JAK2 46/1 haplotype.
title: Variance quantitative trait loci reveal gene-gene interactions which alter blood traits

finding: This loss-of-function mutation at PCK2 was found to associate with extracellular fluid and was noted for its role in fatty liver traits.
title: Genome-wide association study of liver fat, iron, and extracellular fluid fraction in the UK Biobank

finding: Another loss-of-function mutation observed at PCK2 was similarly associated with extracellular fluid fraction.
title: Genome-wide association study of liver fat, iron, and extracellular fluid fraction in the UK Biobank

finding: The sentinel SNP rs4983559 for HDL cholesterol was linked with the gene AKT1, indicating a predictive relationship confirmed by cS2G.
title: Combining SNP-to-gene linking strategies to pinpoint disease genes and assess disease omnigenicity

finding: The SNP rs915057, located in an intron of SYN2, was linked with ESR2 for depression, supporting its role as a disease-associated variant.
title: Combining SNP-to-gene linking strategies to pinpoint disease genes and assess disease omnigenicity

finding: The rs117834516 SNP in FERMT2 was found significant in the PAD analysis with a P-value of 4.82e-08, linking to AD and amyloid burden.
title: Connecting genomic and proteomic signatures of amyloid burden in the brain

finding: This SNP was associated with PSA variation and contributed to the collective association with prostate cancer.
title: Genetically Adjusted PSA Levels for Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: At the TRAF3 locus, rs12147883 was significantly associated with serum IgA levels (Beta=0.05, P=5.42×10^-14), implicating TRAF3 in T cell signaling and IgA production.
title: Genetic regulation of serum IgA levels and susceptibility to common immune, infectious, kidney, and cardio-metabolic traits

finding: The minor A allele of the rs11621525 variant in the HIF1A gene was associated with a lower risk of transitioning to secondary progressive MS (SP-MS) in two cohorts of patients. In the Italian cohort, the odds ratio was 0.57 with a p-value of 3.30x10^-6, suggesting a strong protective effect. This association was replicated in the Swedish cohort with a lead variant rs1951795 showing an odds ratio of 0.79 (p=0.0079). Additionally, carriers of the protective A allele exhibited reduced HIF1A expression in immune cells, lower PRL volume, lower neurofilament levels, and less acute axonal injury in the spinal cord.
title: Genetic variation in HIF1A is associated with smoldering inflammation and disease progression in Multiple Sclerosis

finding: The variant rs1951795, which is in strong linkage disequilibrium with rs11621525 (r^2=0.98), replicated the findings of rs11621525, indicating a protective effect against transition to secondary progressive MS (SP-MS) with an odds ratio of 0.79 and a p-value of 0.0079. Patients carrying the A allele of this variant showed a reduced response in neurofilament levels after treatment with dimethyl fumarate, suggesting its influence on mechanisms involving HIF1A.
title: Genetic variation in HIF1A is associated with smoldering inflammation and disease progression in Multiple Sclerosis

finding: Detected as a significant variant in PSEN1, had a clinical relevance and was found in a pair of siblings within the ADSP study.
title: Frequency of Variants in Mendelian Alzheimer’s Disease Genes within the Alzheimer’s Disease Sequencing Project (ADSP)

finding: Identified as one of the two PSEN1 variants contributing to a higher carrier rate in Alzheimer's disease cases.
title: Frequency of Variants in Mendelian Alzheimer’s Disease Genes within the Alzheimer’s Disease Sequencing Project (ADSP)

finding: The lead variant rs762643 near BMP4 was associated with various outcomes in the FinnGen study, suggesting its relevance in connection with AMH levels and related health conditions.
title: Circulating anti-Müllerian hormone levels in pre-menopausal women: novel genetic insights from a GWAS meta-analysis

finding: The SNP rs370565192 was associated with neck or shoulder pain in the DCAF5 gene on chromosome 14 (p = 3.80 x 10^-8), marking it as a novel finding in relation to this pain phenotype.
title: A Genome-wide Association Study Identifies Novel Genetic Variants Associated with Neck or Shoulder Pain in the UK Biobank (N = 441,757)

finding: The SNP GCH1 rs11158026 significantly correlated with striatal binding ratios of bilateral striatum, indicating its contribution to clinical variables in Parkinson's disease.
title: The multi-modality neuroimaging analysis identified an essential genetic variant associated with Parkinson’s disease

finding: The SNP rs12885387 was identified as a significant intronic variant of the RGS6 gene within the 14q24.2 region, associated with albuminuria, and it explained the admixture association signal.
title: Admixture mapping screening of CKD traits and risk factors in U.S. Hispanic/Latino individuals from Central America country-of-origin

finding: The SNP rs2302144 was identified as the most significant finding in American Indians for albuminuria, with a region-wide significance threshold after FDR correction (P = 9.4×10−5; OR = 1.09).
title: Admixture mapping screening of CKD traits and risk factors in U.S. Hispanic/Latino individuals from Central America country-of-origin

finding: The ASPG locus (lead SNP rs1744294) was linked to asparaginase levels, both of which were associated with metabolic disorders.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: The CYP3A5 locus (lead SNP rs1744297) had implications for various hormone levels.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: The SNP rs1712355 was found significantly associated with heart failure (HF) at a Bonferroni-corrected replication threshold, reinforcing its potential role in HF risk.
title: Common- and rare-variant genetic architecture of heart failure across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: This SNP was a missense variant in SERPINA1, which interacts with the plasminogen-activating system.
title: Mapping pQTLs of circulating inflammatory proteins identifies drivers of immune-related disease risk and novel therapeutic targets

finding: The rs33912345 variant in the SIX6 locus was associated with primary open-angle glaucoma (POAG) and was found to interact significantly with variants in the chr9p21.3 CDKN2B-AS1 locus, affecting the expression of the primary cilia genes CDKN2A and CDKN2B. Its presence was correlated with downregulated expression of SALRNA1 and SIX6, indicating its role in lower gene expression related to POAG.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel ancestry-specific primary open-angle glaucoma loci and shared biology with vascular mechanisms and cell proliferation

finding: The proxy SNP rs7493429, which was in high linkage disequilibrium with the missense variant rs33912345, was shown to impact the expression of genes within the SIX6 locus in muscle skeletal tissue, further supporting its connection to POAG.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel ancestry-specific primary open-angle glaucoma loci and shared biology with vascular mechanisms and cell proliferation

finding: For SNP rs10083370, it was found that the G allele associated with schizophrenia risk was correlated with increased expression of PPP1R13B in the caudate nucleus, while this expression decreased slightly in the DLPFC. This finding suggested a region-dependent influence of the risk allele on gene expression linked to schizophrenia.
title: Caudate transcriptome implicates decreased presynaptic autoregulation as the dopamine risk factor for schizophrenia

finding: The SNP rs8181938 was identified as a lead cis-pQTL for the protein MAX. This association was found to relate to various body traits such as height and forced vital capacity. The study noted that this association may represent vertical pleiotropy, which minimizes confounding biases in the Mendelian randomisation analysis.
title: Integrative proteogenomics study identifies the indirect effect of circulating proteins on 8 diseases via telomere length

finding: The SNP rs34354104 was recognized as a lead cis-pQTL for the protein GMPR2, which was also associated with body-related traits like mean corpuscular hemoglobin and volume. Similar to MAX, this finding was interpreted within the context of vertical pleiotropy, supporting the robustness of the MR analysis with respect to potential reverse causation.
title: Integrative proteogenomics study identifies the indirect effect of circulating proteins on 8 diseases via telomere length

finding: It demonstrated a significant positive correlation with non-AD inflammation exclusively in females.
title: Multivariate GWAS of Alzheimer’s disease CSF biomarker profiles implies GRIN2D in synaptic functioning

finding: The SNP rs979812 was strongly associated with increased GalCase enzymatic activity (b=1.2; se=0.06; p=5.10E-95) in a GWAS meta-analysis with data from 976 Parkinson's disease patients. This SNP was also noted to be associated with increased GALC expression, suggesting a link between increased GalCase activity and the risk of Parkinson's disease.
title: GALC variants affect galactosylceramidase enzymatic activity and risk of Parkinson’s disease

finding: The common variant p.I562T (rs398607) was associated with increased GALC activity (b=1.65, se=0.05, p=2.70E-242) and was noted to be in partial linkage disequilibrium with rs979812. This finding, however, did not reach GWAS significance in the context of Parkinson's disease.
title: GALC variants affect galactosylceramidase enzymatic activity and risk of Parkinson’s disease

finding: A significant hypomethylation in the ICR associated with subfertility (SF) was observed compared to control placentas, particularly highlighting decreased total DNA methylation (P = 0.003 at CpG1). Furthermore, the paternal allele was distinguished using this SNP, revealing its role in the context of the paternal imprinting in the DLK1-DIO3 locus.
title: Genome-wide DNA methylation, imprinting, and gene expression in human placentas derived from Assisted Reproductive Technology

finding: Similar to rs1884539, significant changes were noted in the ICR's DNA methylation profile in SF placentas when compared to controls, with decreased methylation (P = 0.007 at CpG2). This SNP also contributed to distinguishing between paternal and maternal alleles, emphasizing its importance in the imprinting regulation at the DLK1-DIO3 locus.
title: Genome-wide DNA methylation, imprinting, and gene expression in human placentas derived from Assisted Reproductive Technology

finding: The SNP rs61996057, located at 14q32.33, was associated with syndromes featuring facial dysmorphisms and achieved suggestive significance with a p-value of 8.07×10^-8 in the analysis of unilateral cleft lip (UCL). This suggests a potential link between this locus and craniofacial development.
title: The PAX1 locus at 20p11 is a modifier for bilateral cleft lip only

finding: Located near FBLN5, this SNP was associated with descending aortic distensibility, noting its connection to cardiovascular health.
title: GENOME-WIDE ASSOCIATIONS OF AORTIC DISTENSIBILITY SUGGEST CAUSAL RELATIONSHIPS WITH AORTIC ANEURYSMS AND BRAIN WHITE MATTER HYPERINTENSITIES

finding: This SNP was linked to DAdis in CCDC175, being a significant eQTL and indicating its functional role in aortic health.
title: GENOME-WIDE ASSOCIATIONS OF AORTIC DISTENSIBILITY SUGGEST CAUSAL RELATIONSHIPS WITH AORTIC ANEURYSMS AND BRAIN WHITE MATTER HYPERINTENSITIES

finding: The SNP rs12887440, found in the gene RCOR1, had an association with early-onset gout, reaching a meta-analysis P value of 3.37 × 10^-8 and an odds ratio of 1.48. It was linked to increased RCOR1 expression in peripheral blood leukocytes.
title: Novel genetic loci in adolescent-onset gout derived from whole genome sequencing of a Chinese cohort

finding: The SNP rs8009475, linked to RCOR1, had a meta-analysis P value of 4.18 × 10^-8 and an odds ratio of 1.48, confirmed as related to inflammatory processes but not associated with serum urate levels.
title: Novel genetic loci in adolescent-onset gout derived from whole genome sequencing of a Chinese cohort

finding: This SNP at the SERPINA locus was significantly associated with advanced AMD, with a P-value of 2.95×10^-8 and an odds ratio of 1.54, highlighting its relevance despite being newly identified in this study compared to previous analyses.
title: Diverse ancestry GWAS for advanced age-related macular degeneration in TOPMed-imputed and Ophthalmologically-confirmed 16,108 cases and 18,038 controls

finding: The SNP rs56994090, associated with the maternally expressed gene 3 (MEG3), showed a significant protective effect on PD risk with a Wald ratio odds ratio of 0.67 (95% CI 0.46-0.96, p=0.03). This was noted in studies examining the relationship between T1D and PD.
title: Potential protective link between type I diabetes and Parkinson’s disease risk and progression

finding: The SNP rs4900384, also located near the MEG3 gene, was potentially linked to a protective effect for cognitive progression in Parkinson's disease as measured by the MoCA cognitive scale, with a Wald ratio odds ratio of 17.25 (95% CI 1.86-159.50, p=0.010). This analysis was part of investigating the genetic correlations between T1D and PD.
title: Potential protective link between type I diabetes and Parkinson’s disease risk and progression

finding: This variant was noted to colocalize with lipid disease, identified as an African-enriched eQTL with a PP4 of 0.85 and present at a frequency of 17.5% in 1000 Genomes Africans.
title: A Southern African Map of Blood Regulatory Variation Enables GWAS Interpretation

finding: The SLC24A4:rs12881735-C variant was classified as protective, showing a diminution of AD risk in certain ancestral backgrounds.
title: Biobank-scale characterization of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias identifies potential disease-causing variants, risk factors, and genetic modifiers across diverse ancestries

finding: The variant rs28929474 (p.Glu366Lys) in SERPINA1 was associated with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) and had the highest PIP in the corresponding non-suspicious loci.
title: Meta-analysis fine-mapping is often miscalibrated at single-variant resolution

finding: This variant (p.Pro558Thr) in RTL1 was successfully fine-mapped and showed relevance in asthma with implications for height reduction.
title: Meta-analysis fine-mapping is often miscalibrated at single-variant resolution

finding: This variant marked a previously noted risk locus at 14q32.13-<italic>TCL1A</italic>, showing opposite effects in DNMT3A- and TET2-CH.
title: Genome-wide analyses of 200,453 individuals yields new insights into the causes and consequences of clonal hematopoiesis

finding: Identified at 14q32.13-<italic>TCL1A</italic>, this variant conferred increased risk for DNMT3A-CH while paradoxically reducing hematological mCA risk.
title: Genome-wide analyses of 200,453 individuals yields new insights into the causes and consequences of clonal hematopoiesis

finding: This variant in MARK3 demonstrated strong association with otosclerosis with an odds ratio of 1.38 and influenced gene expressions across multiple tissues.
title: Genome-wide Screen of Otosclerosis in Population Biobanks: 18 Loci and Shared Heritability with Skeletal Structure

finding: This SNP was closely associated with otosclerosis alongside rs1951391 in MARK3; both variants were significant in their association with the disease.
title: Genome-wide Screen of Otosclerosis in Population Biobanks: 18 Loci and Shared Heritability with Skeletal Structure

finding: Associated with lung cancer, this SNP in PPP2R5E showed strong associations specifically within European populations.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: This SNP was associated with TBA levels, contributing to an average increase of 6.41 µmol/L per risk allele. It is part of the East-Asian-specific genetic locus at 14q24.1 and contributes to a 15.23-fold higher risk of intrahepatic cholestasis of pregnancy (ICP).
title: Genetic study of intrahepatic cholestasis of pregnancy in 101,023 Chinese women unveils East Asian-specific etiology linked to historic HBV infection

finding: The SNP is associated with ICP and serves as part of the East-Asian-specific genetic locus at 14q24.1, contributing to a significant increased risk of ICP.
title: Genetic study of intrahepatic cholestasis of pregnancy in 101,023 Chinese women unveils East Asian-specific etiology linked to historic HBV infection

finding: This missense variant (p.Ser267Phe) in the SLC10A1 gene was significantly associated with both TBA and ICP risk, indicating a 15.23 odds ratio for ICP and suggesting a protective role against hepatitis B virus (HBV) infection.
title: Genetic study of intrahepatic cholestasis of pregnancy in 101,023 Chinese women unveils East Asian-specific etiology linked to historic HBV infection

finding: The intron variant was part of the analysis, indicating close association with both TBA and HBV infection traits, confirming its genetic involvement in the loci connected to ICP.
title: Genetic study of intrahepatic cholestasis of pregnancy in 101,023 Chinese women unveils East Asian-specific etiology linked to historic HBV infection

finding: The SNP rs7145882 in the TRAF3 gene was also found to be causally associated with MS susceptibility. Similar to rs2076343, it showed significant connections between mRNA expression and the corresponding protein translation, reinforcing its relevance to MS.
title: Multi-omics integration prioritizes potential drug targets for multiple sclerosis

finding: The variant rs147021911 (chr14:45658326C>T, c.5101 C>T, p.Gln1701*) was strongly associated with ER-negative breast cancer, showing an overall odds ratio (OR) of 3.0 (95% CI: 0.6-14.7) and specifically for ER-negative cases an OR of 11.3 (95% CI: 2.1-62.2). This finding was significant in identifying women at increased risk for developing ER-negative breast cancer in the Hispanic/Latina cohort.
title: Whole exome sequencing and replication for breast cancer among Hispanic/Latino women identifies FANCM as a susceptibility gene for estrogen-receptor-negative breast cancer

finding: The variant rs144567652 (chr14:45667921C>A/C>T, c.5791C>T, p.Arg1931*) demonstrated a strong association with ER-negative breast cancer risk, with an overall OR of 3.2 (95% CI: 1.0-9.8) and an ER-negative-specific OR of 8.1 (95% CI: 2.3-29.0). This association supports the variant's role in increased susceptibility to ER-negative breast cancer.
title: Whole exome sequencing and replication for breast cancer among Hispanic/Latino women identifies FANCM as a susceptibility gene for estrogen-receptor-negative breast cancer

finding: The SLC24A4:rs12881735-C variant was identified as protective, highlighting its possible involvement in mitigating AD risk.
title: Biobank-scale characterization of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias identifies potential disease-causing variants, risk factors, and genetic modifiers across diverse ancestries

finding: The SNP rs34485356 was an intergenic variant located 60 kb upstream of the BDKRB2 gene. It was associated with ACEi-related angioedema at genome-wide significance (P < 5 × 10^-8) in a discovery cohort of 462 cases and replicated in a cohort of 144 cases. The odds ratio for angioedema risk was 1.62 (95 % CI 1.38 to 1.90; P = 4.3 × 10^-9) in the discovery cohort and 1.60 (95 % CI 1.13 to 2.25; P = 7.2 × 10^-3) in the replication cohort. Carriers of the T allele also showed significantly lower systolic (−0.46 mmHg per T allele; P = 0.013) and diastolic blood pressure (−0.26 mmHg per T allele; P = 0.013).
title: Common variants near the bradykinin receptor B2 gene are associated with angioedema induced by angiotensin-converting-enzyme inhibitor treatment - a genome wide association study

finding: The proxy variant rs72704813 was identified as a candidate SNP, demonstrating a significant association with a P value of 1.6 × 10^-10 and a perfect correlation (r² = 1.0) with the lead SNP rs34485356. It had the lowest RegulomeDB score of 2b, indicating a strong likelihood of affecting transcription factor binding, and the highest CADD score of 18.11, suggesting that variation at this locus could have deleterious effects.
title: Common variants near the bradykinin receptor B2 gene are associated with angioedema induced by angiotensin-converting-enzyme inhibitor treatment - a genome wide association study

finding: Associated with an increase in circulating sclerostin (β=0.173, P=1.1×10^-10), this SNP located in the SERPINA1 region suggested a role in modulating sclerostin levels, even though the causal mechanisms remain unclear.
title: Lowering of circulating sclerostin may increase risk of atherosclerosis and its risk factors: evidence from a genome-wide association meta-analysis followed by Mendelian randomization

finding: Linked to increased levels of circulating sclerostin (β=0.053, P=3.35×10^-8), this SNP in the RIN3 region was noted for its association with lower limb BMD.
title: Lowering of circulating sclerostin may increase risk of atherosclerosis and its risk factors: evidence from a genome-wide association meta-analysis followed by Mendelian randomization

finding: The study showed a significant genotype-by-smoking interaction for the rs28929474 variant associated with alpha-1 antitrypsin deficiency (AATD). This interaction was linked to lung function, specifically FEV<sub>1</sub>, and it highlighted the increased risk of emphysema in individuals with this genotype who were also ever-smokers.
title: Smoking Interaction with a Polygenic Risk Score for Reduced Lung Function

finding: The SNP rs57645874 showed an association with Elision in CFSRS (p=1×10⁻⁶) and reading accuracy as measured by NARA-A in ALSPAC (p=0.02), highlighting its role in speech and reading abilities.
title: Association between genes regulating neural pathways for quantitative traits of speech and language disorders

finding: The SNP rs4981288 was a meQTL for the methylation marker cg07166546, showing strong association (p=2×10⁻⁵⁰) and was significantly linked to Elision in CFSRS (p=3×10⁻⁵) and other reading measures.
title: Association between genes regulating neural pathways for quantitative traits of speech and language disorders

finding: SNP rs856379 was identified as being significantly associated with MSW in CFSRS (p=3×10⁻⁶) and nonword reading (ALSPACread) in ALSPAC with a p-value of 0.036, suggesting its involvement in reading-related skills.
title: Association between genes regulating neural pathways for quantitative traits of speech and language disorders

finding: The variant rs1257267 was associated with WRMT-AT in CFSRS (p=6.58×10⁻⁶) and with nonsense word repetition (CNrep5) in ALSPAC (p=0.05). It was also identified as a meQTL for cg18949721 (p=4×10⁻¹²), indicating its relevance in reading comprehension.
title: Association between genes regulating neural pathways for quantitative traits of speech and language disorders

finding: The rs138577661 variant, a known pathogenic variant associated with Krabbe's disease in East Asian populations, was found in the context of pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC) research, highlighting its considerable contribution to PDAC development among Korean patients. Functional testing validated its impact on lysosomal activity in PDAC cell lines.
title: Lysosomal Storage Dysfunction, a Germline Variants Affecting Pancreatic Ductal Adenocarcinoma Development and Progression

finding: Similar to rs138577661, the rs200607029 variant was identified as a significant putative pathogenic variant in the Korean PDAC population, contributing to conditions related to lysosome storage dysfunction, implicating it in PDAC development.
title: Lysosomal Storage Dysfunction, a Germline Variants Affecting Pancreatic Ductal Adenocarcinoma Development and Progression

finding: This SNP was the lead at 14q21.2 with p=1.14×10^-6 and OR=1.95, also located in a genomic desert.
title: Genome-wide association studies of Down syndrome associated congenital heart defects

finding: The SNP rs8010015 also emerged as a positive original finding, particularly linked to the resistance mechanisms in glioblastoma (GBM). This SNP was shown to be associated with adverse survival outcomes in patients receiving radiotherapy, suggesting a potential role in mediating the tumor's resilience against treatment.
title: Variability in Radiotherapy Outcomes Across Cancer Types: A Comparative Study of Glioblastoma Multiforme and Low-Grade Gliomas

finding: The intronic variant rs35131341 in BCL11B was associated with lower volume in medial fronto-parietal areas, bilateral Heschl’s gyri, and planum temporale, indicating its relevance in dyslexia susceptibility.
title: Distinct impact modes of polygenic disposition to dyslexia in the adult brain

finding: The DAAM1 locus variant rs36065072 was associated with increased volume of the primary visual cortex, emphasizing its influence on visual processing aspects tied to dyslexia.
title: Distinct impact modes of polygenic disposition to dyslexia in the adult brain

finding: The SNP rs979812 was strongly associated with increased GalCase activity (b=1.2; se=0.06; p=5.10E-95) in both cohorts and in the meta-analysis, suggesting a role in Parkinson's disease risk through alterations in GalCase enzyme levels.
title: GALC variants affect galactosylceramidase enzymatic activity and risk of Parkinson’s disease

finding: The SNP rs41286550, also within the KCNK10 gene, indicated that females with TN onset at age 45 or younger had a lower HRG frequency (2%) than females with later onset (6%) and males regardless of age (8%), highlighting potential age-related genetic susceptibilities.
title: Role of common and rare genetic variants in the aetiology of trigeminal neuralgia

finding: The variant rs989909 was associated with mitral valve prolapse and overlapped an enhancer that was predicted to regulate LTBP2 expression in all VIC populations. This variant was predicted to create a composite GATA/TAL motif instance, thus influencing gene expression relevant to congenital heart defects.
title: Molecular convergence of risk variants for congenital heart defects leveraging a regulatory map of the human fetal heart

finding: The rs1042704 variant, identified as a missense variant (p.D273N) in the MMP14 gene, was found to significantly reduce collagen catabolism. This finding related to spinal degeneration, indicating that modifications in collagen structures are often observed in LSS pathogenesis. However, PheWAS results showed that this variant might protect against LSS while simultaneously increasing the risk of Dupuytren contracture and adhesive capsulitis, making it less suitable for translational research.
title: Genetic architecture of lumbar spinal stenosis

finding: The rs10141120 SNP, located in MARK3, was found to be involved in the cell cycle regulation and DNA damage response, potentially implicating it in the carcinogenesis of skin cancers like basal cell carcinoma.
title: A multi-phenotype analysis reveals 19 novel susceptibility loci for basal cell carcinoma and 15 for squamous cell carcinoma

finding: This SNP in CDKL1 was associated with promoting tumor cell proliferation and migration across multiple cancer types.
title: A multi-phenotype analysis reveals 19 novel susceptibility loci for basal cell carcinoma and 15 for squamous cell carcinoma

finding: This SNP in GCKR was recognized as affecting triglycerides and glucose metabolism, suggesting a possible connection to skin cancer risk.
title: A multi-phenotype analysis reveals 19 novel susceptibility loci for basal cell carcinoma and 15 for squamous cell carcinoma

finding: This non-synonymous variant in the membrane type 1 matrix metalloproteinase (MT1-MMP) protein replicated an earlier reported etiological change, which was known to reduce collagenolytic activity, implicating its role in DD.
title: A meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies in 614,243 individuals identifies 59 novel susceptibility loci underlying Dupuytren’s contracture

finding: SNP rs12590654, associated with RIN3, was significantly enriched in healthy centenarians, supporting its role in neuro-protective mechanisms via endo-lysosomal pathways.
title: Cognitively Healthy Centenarians are genetically protected against Alzheimer’s disease specifically in immune and endo-lysosomal systems

finding: SNP rs7401792, related to RIN3, was also enriched in centenarians, corroborating its involvement in regulating endosomal trafficking crucial for reducing AD risk.
title: Cognitively Healthy Centenarians are genetically protected against Alzheimer’s disease specifically in immune and endo-lysosomal systems

finding: The SNP rs11845184 was noted as a missense variant located within SECISBP2L, with high expression in brain-related tissues. This identified it as a putative causal variant related to the regulatory pathways involved in oligodendrocyte differentiation and potentially relevant to Crohn's disease (CD).
title: Genome-wide fine-mapping improves identification of causal variants

finding: The missense SNV on RIN3 was another novel suggestive-level association found in the AD-age score linear regression, which also replicated nominally.
title: A novel age-informed approach for genetic association analysis in Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The rs28929474 variant was associated with the level of glycoprotein acetyl, which comprises a mixture of N-glycoproteins including alpha-1 acid glycoprotein, haptoglobin, and alpha-1-antitrypsin. Although no colocalization between the SERPINA1 glyQTL and the AAT pQTL was observed, the association suggests a genetic influence on the glycoprotein levels in the context of liver-expressed genes involved in plasma protein N-glycosylation.
title: A genome-wide association study in 10,000 individuals links plasma N-glycome to liver disease and anti-inflammatory proteins

finding: The SNP rs1972565 was the most significant variant at the VSX2 locus, associated with PRC thickness, particularly impacting ocular development, with pathogenic variants linked to microphthalmia.
title: Sub-cellular level resolution of common genetic variation in the photoreceptor layer identifies continuum between rare disease and common variation

finding: The SNP rs112145470 showed interaction within the VSX2 locus affecting ONL thickness, indicating its role in modulating PRC morphology.
title: Sub-cellular level resolution of common genetic variation in the photoreceptor layer identifies continuum between rare disease and common variation

finding: The SNP rs28488340 exhibited interaction effects within the same VSX2 locus impacting ONL thickness, further confirming allelic heterogeneity.
title: Sub-cellular level resolution of common genetic variation in the photoreceptor layer identifies continuum between rare disease and common variation

finding: This variant on chromosome 14 was significantly associated with lower odds of prostate cancer in the European ancestry group, suggesting a protective role against this disease.
title: Discovery of Novel Trans-Ancestry and Ancestry-Specific Gene Loci for Total Testosterone in a Multi-Ancestral Analysis of Men in the Million Veteran Program

finding: A missense variant in SERPINA1, which participates in the plasminogen activation system, linking it to the inflammatory response.
title: Mapping pQTLs of circulating inflammatory proteins identifies drivers of immune-related disease risk and novel therapeutic targets

finding: In the deCODE study, the rs61976125 variant showed strong evidence of being a causal variant associated with plasma protein levels that had been linked to prostate cancer (PCa) risk, demonstrating a high posterior probability of colocalization (PPH4 = 0.952). This suggested its potential as a therapeutic target for PCa.
title: Causal associations between plasma proteins and prostate cancer: a Proteome-Wide Mendelian Randomization

finding: In the Fenland study, the rs6575449 variant was identified as a causal variant associated with plasma protein levels, which were corroborated by strong statistical evidence of colocalization with PCa (PPH4 = 0.951). This indicated its relevance in PCa risk and its potential as a target for treatment.
title: Causal associations between plasma proteins and prostate cancer: a Proteome-Wide Mendelian Randomization

finding: Also associated with non-AD inflammation (PC4), this SNP showed significant effects exclusively in females (+1.39SD, SE=0.25, p=2.6*10^-8), lacking male associations.
title: Multivariate GWAS of Alzheimer’s disease CSF biomarker profiles implies GRIN2D in synaptic functioning

finding: This SNP was novel and had a potential functional impact due to its non-synonymous protein effect, indicating it could be relevant in the molecular mechanisms underlying mood and alcohol-related disorders.
title: Genetic overlap between mood instability and alcohol-related phenotypes suggests shared biological underpinnings

finding: The variant rs2664299 at locus 14q32.2 was associated with snoring and volume of the left thalamus proper, showing high Bayesian colocalization probability.
title: The role of sleep in the human brain and body: insights from multi-organ imaging genetics

finding: The alternative allele of rs724391 (C) was associated with decreased excision of exon 10 of WARS1, correlating with increased plasma levels of the protein and a heightened risk of hypertension.
title: Genetic determinants of blood gene expression and splicing and their contribution to molecular phenotypes and health outcomes

finding: This SNP was identified as the top prioritized variant at its locus due to strong association signals and its role in TH cell regulation.
title: Triangulating molecular evidence to prioritise candidate causal genes at established atopic dermatitis loci

finding: Prioritized SNP at the locus associated with TRAF3, underscoring its potential involvement in signaling pathways relevant to AD.
title: Triangulating molecular evidence to prioritise candidate causal genes at established atopic dermatitis loci

finding: The SNP was analyzed and found within TRAF3, indicating its potential role in immune signaling related to AD.
title: Triangulating molecular evidence to prioritise candidate causal genes at established atopic dermatitis loci

finding: This SNP was linked to TRAF3 and indicated a role in immune response signaling.
title: Triangulating molecular evidence to prioritise candidate causal genes at established atopic dermatitis loci

finding: Represented a potential candidate SNP with influence on immune mechanisms related to TRAF3.
title: Triangulating molecular evidence to prioritise candidate causal genes at established atopic dermatitis loci

finding: The rs959388/PRKD1 variant showed associations with BMI, smoking, and blood pressure, contributing to its classification as a heart failure risk variant.
title: Genome-wide association analysis and Mendelian randomization proteomics identify drug targets for heart failure

finding: The variant rs35337422-C in RD3L was significantly associated with thickening of the inner plexiform layer (IPL) and inner nuclear layer (INL), suggesting a contribution to the structural changes in these layers.
title: Insights into human health from phenome- and genome-wide analyses of UK Biobank retinal optical coherence tomography phenotypes

finding: The rs12895357 SNP was found to be associated with the rate of somatic expansion in individuals with SCA3. Specifically, the presence of the C-allele phase with expanded alleles correlated with higher levels of somatic expansion. This finding suggested that the C-allele could modify the dynamics of genetic instability in SCA3, indicating its potential role as a biomarker for clinical outcomes and therapeutic targets.
title: Age-dependent somatic expansion of the ATXN3 CAG repeat in the blood and buccal cell DNA of individuals with spinocerebellar ataxia type 3

finding: The rs33912345 missense variant was crucial in elucidating the pathogenesis of POAG, being linked to expression alterations in the SIX6 locus.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel ancestry-specific primary open-angle glaucoma loci and shared biology with vascular mechanisms and cell proliferation

finding: This proxy variant was used to study implications of rs33912345 in POAG, showing a strong association with altered gene expression.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel ancestry-specific primary open-angle glaucoma loci and shared biology with vascular mechanisms and cell proliferation

finding: This SNP was identified as a cis-miR-eQTL for miR-625-5p, explaining 11% of the variance in its expression levels in plasma, showing a significant association with a P-value of 1.63×10^-60.
title: An atlas of genetic regulation and disease associations of microRNAs

finding: In perfect linkage disequilibrium with rs2127868, this SNP was linked to the levels of miR-625-5p, establishing its significant connection with gene expression.
title: An atlas of genetic regulation and disease associations of microRNAs

finding: The association between SNP rs945270 and putamen volume was positively confirmed in the neonatal cohort, with a greater number of C alleles associated with larger putamen volume (β=0.128, SE=0.044, P=3.67×10^-3). This association replicated across multiple ancestral groups, indicating its relevance in both infants and adults.
title: Common Genetic Variation Important in Early Subcortical Brain Development

finding: In the Australian dataset, the rs200603922 variant in PARP2 exhibited a significant association with PrCa risk, with a p-value of 0.028, highlighting its potential impact on familial cases.
title: Germline sequencing of DNA-damage-repair genes in two hereditary prostate cancer cohorts reveals rare risk-associated variants

finding: The SNP rs1884539 was associated with changes in DNA methylation at the DLK1-DIO3 locus. The study found that the paternal allele showed decreased total DNA methylation in subfertile (SF) placentas compared to control placentas, indicating regulatory alterations impacting growth and metabolic features linked to assisted reproductive technology (ART).
title: Genome-wide DNA methylation, imprinting, and gene expression in human placentas derived from Assisted Reproductive Technology

finding: Similar to rs1884539, the SNP rs75998174 was also related to alterations in DNA methylation of the DLK1-DIO3 imprinted region.
