The research highlighted decreased total DNA methylation at this ICR in subfertile placentas when compared to controls, implicating both this SNP and the regulatory mechanisms in the context of ART-associated imprinting disorders.
title: Genome-wide DNA methylation, imprinting, and gene expression in human placentas derived from Assisted Reproductive Technology

finding: rs60820638 emerged as a novel secondary association at the CEBPE locus with a significant P-value of 5.38 x 10^-8. This association contributed new understanding about genetic factors in ALL.
title: Genome-wide trans-ethnic meta-analysis identifies novel susceptibility loci for childhood acute lymphoblastic leukemia

finding: rs2239635 was significantly associated with ALL as part of the secondary association at the CEBPE locus, with functional implications suggested by correlation patterns.
title: Genome-wide trans-ethnic meta-analysis identifies novel susceptibility loci for childhood acute lymphoblastic leukemia

finding: Similar to rs2239635, rs2239630 showed association as part of the secondary signal at the CEBPE locus, thus contributing to understanding of ALL risk factors.
title: Genome-wide trans-ethnic meta-analysis identifies novel susceptibility loci for childhood acute lymphoblastic leukemia

finding: The SNP rs1152591 was associated with multiple potential target genes beyond the nearest one, demonstrating a high posterior inclusion probability (PIP = 0.96). PC-HiC links suggested regulatory interactions with four genes, including SYNE2 and AKAP5, despite these not being the closest genes to the SNP.
title: Single-cell genomics improves the discovery of risk variants and genes of cardiac traits

finding: The SNP rs117972357, an enhancer, was linked to a CTCF-cohesin sequence regulating long-range genome interactions. This intronic SNP was considered in regulatory contexts to improve our understanding of its potential role in disease.
title: Novel discoveries and enhanced genomic prediction from modelling genetic risk of cancer age-at-onset

finding: The rs1991517 polymorphism was identified as a genetic risk factor for congenital hypothyroidism (CH), indicating that it may play a significant role in the development of this condition. This finding was particularly relevant to the populations examined in the study, as CH is a common cause of intellectual disability that can be prevented with timely diagnosis and treatment.
title: Investigation of risk factors for congenital hypothyroidism (CH) using a population-based case-control study as part of the 2015-2018 screening program in Kohgiluyeh and Boyer Ahmad province in southwestern Iran

finding: SLC24A4:rs12881735-C was found to be protective against AD.
title: Biobank-scale characterization of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias identifies potential disease-causing variants, risk factors, and genetic modifiers across diverse ancestries

finding: The rs17111346-G variant was associated with increased TSH levels and reduced FT4 levels during the early gestational period (8-12 weeks). This association highlighted a genetic explanation for hypothyroxinemia that could occur despite hCG stimulation.
title: Genome-wide association studies of thyroid-related hormones, dysfunction, and autoimmunity among 85,421 Chinese pregnancies

finding: This intronic variant within GPR132 was associated across multiple ancestries and was prioritized due to its relevance to inflammation.
title: European and multi-ancestry genome-wide association meta-analysis of atopic dermatitis highlights importance of systemic immune regulation

finding: The locus around SERPINA, with lead variant rs28929474, was newly identified in IAMDGC 2.0, showing association with advanced AMD and is highly correlated to a previously identified variant linked to SERPINA1 protein structure.
title: Diverse ancestry GWAS for advanced age-related macular degeneration in TOPMed-imputed and Ophthalmologically-confirmed 16,108 cases and 18,038 controls

finding: The polymorphism rs1884539 (A/G) located at the DLK1-DIO3 ICR was associated with observed changes in the expression levels related to the imprinted endocrine signaling molecule DLK1 in ART placentas. This finding was relevant to the mechanisms underlying metabolic and phenotypic changes linked to assisted reproductive technology (ART). The analysis highlighted implications of impaired growth and metabolic disturbances arising from ART.
title: Genome-wide DNA methylation, imprinting, and gene expression in human placentas derived from Assisted Reproductive Technology

finding: The rs75998174 (A/G) polymorphism, also at the DLK1-DIO3 ICR, was implicated in the observed differences in DNA methylation patterns between ART and control samples. This SNP was associated with a downregulation of DLK1 expression, reflecting potential alterations in imprinting stability that could underlie the growth and metabolic phenotypes observed in ART-affected placentas.
title: Genome-wide DNA methylation, imprinting, and gene expression in human placentas derived from Assisted Reproductive Technology

finding: The variant rs63750082 (p.Gly206Ala) was identified in a pair of siblings within the family sub-study and was notably prevalent among AD cases, contributing to the higher rates of clinical variant carriers. Its presence may indicate unique pathogenic mechanisms, particularly affecting Hispanic individuals.
title: Frequency of Variants in Mendelian Alzheimer’s Disease Genes within the Alzheimer’s Disease Sequencing Project (ADSP)

finding: The deletion variant rs63750219 was noted among three inferred cousins, suggesting possible familial inheritance patterns associated with AD. This variant indicates its relevance in the clinical context of Alzheimer's Disease.
title: Frequency of Variants in Mendelian Alzheimer’s Disease Genes within the Alzheimer’s Disease Sequencing Project (ADSP)

finding: The variant rs63749824 (p.Ala79Val) was recognized as one of the two main variants contributing to the elevated carrier rate of PSEN1 among Alzheimer's Disease cases, highlighting its significance in AD pathology.
title: Frequency of Variants in Mendelian Alzheimer’s Disease Genes within the Alzheimer’s Disease Sequencing Project (ADSP)

finding: The SNP rs112806369, a single nucleotide polymorphism differentiating the IGHV1-2 alleles *02 and *04, was found to correlate with the frequencies of VRC01-class B cell responses post-vaccination. Specifically, the presence of the *02 allele was associated with stronger vaccine-induced B cell precursor responses compared to the *04 allele, due to a higher frequency of *02-using B cell precursors. This was evidenced by the median ratio of *02 to *04 BCRs being 7.3 across participants, indicating a significant enhancement (P-value = 0.004) in VRC01-class responses linked to the *02 allele.
title: Human immunoglobulin gene allelic variation impacts germline-targeting vaccine priming

finding: This SNP, located in an intron of the AKAP6 gene, was significant (p = 1.2 × 10^-8) for its interaction effect, where homozygotes for the minor allele displayed decreased risk for depression as stressful life events increased.
title: Genome-wide by environment interaction study of stressful life events and hospital-treated depression in the iPSYCH2012 sample

finding: The SNP rs1111179 was found to be significantly associated with major depressive disorder (MDD) through its mQTL relationship with the CpG site cg10318063.
title: Potentially causal associations between placental DNA methylation and schizophrenia and other neuropsychiatric disorders

finding: The SNP rs61990289 demonstrated a significant association with major depressive disorder (MDD) related to the mQTL-CpG cg23217097.
title: Potentially causal associations between placental DNA methylation and schizophrenia and other neuropsychiatric disorders

finding: The SNP rs10220464 located at the TDRD9 locus on chromosome 14 was significantly associated with lower percent predicted FEV1 (p=2.4×10^-9; βz=-0.31, 95% CI=-0.41 to -0.21). It was identified as a lead SNP in a genome-wide association study (GWAS) and was shown to be involved in the regulation of DNA methylation levels associated with impaired lung function in children, highlighting a potential mechanism for reduced lung function due to increased apoptosis in airway epithelial cells.
title: Multi-omic association study implicates PPP1R13B in DNA methylation-mediated genotype and smoking exposure effects on decreased lung function in urban children

finding: The rs2268616 variant was identified as significant in the joint analyses for sex and cardiometabolic diseases, with a genome-wide significance p-value of 2.67×10^-8. It was associated with worse COVID-19 outcomes and showed stronger genetic effects in males (OR = 1.79) and individuals with type 2 diabetes (T2D) (OR = 2.01). The variant was located in an intron of the PGF gene and is thought to influence transcription and immune response relevant to COVID-19 severity.
title: Gene-environment interaction analysis incorporating sex, cardiometabolic diseases, and multiple deprivation index reveals novel genetic associations with COVID-19 severity

finding: The GCH1 rs11158026 T-carriers had higher UPDRS-III scores compared to CC carriers, indicating it modifies motor symptoms in Parkinson's disease.
title: Parkinson’s disease-associated genetic variants synergistically shape brain networks

finding: This SNP was identified as a significant risk locus associated with both IBD and ALS, showing a p-value of 2.54×10^-7 and a false discovery rate (FDR) of 3.48×10^-2. It was associated with the gene SCFD1.
title: Inflammatory Bowel Disease and Neurodegenerative Disorders: Integrated Evidence from Mendelian Randomization, Shared Genetic Architecture and Transcriptomics

finding: This SNP was also identified as a significant risk locus linked to IBD and ALS with a p-value of 3.81×10^-7 and an FDR of 4.64×10^-2, associated with SCFD1.
title: Inflammatory Bowel Disease and Neurodegenerative Disorders: Integrated Evidence from Mendelian Randomization, Shared Genetic Architecture and Transcriptomics

finding: This SNP represented another significant risk locus identified in the study with a p-value of 4.46×10^-7 and an FDR of 2.70×10^-2, related to the gene G2E3.
title: Inflammatory Bowel Disease and Neurodegenerative Disorders: Integrated Evidence from Mendelian Randomization, Shared Genetic Architecture and Transcriptomics

finding: This SNP was found as a significant risk locus associated with IBD and ALS, showing a p-value of 9.58×10^-7 and an FDR of 3.45×10^-2, which is linked to G2E3.
title: Inflammatory Bowel Disease and Neurodegenerative Disorders: Integrated Evidence from Mendelian Randomization, Shared Genetic Architecture and Transcriptomics

finding: The SNP rs764971634, which caused a p.Ile437Val mutation in PSEN1, was significantly associated with Alzheimer's disease (AD) with a P-value of 2×10^-12.
title: Leveraging large-scale multi-omics to identify therapeutic targets from genome-wide association studies

finding: The SNP rs2749527 at the SERPINA1/6 locus had a significant association with reduced plasma cortisol levels (p=1.75e-13) and reduced CST3 gene expression in visceral adipose tissue, indicating a link between cortisol and the production of Cystatin C (CyC). It served as a trans-eQTL for CST3 and a cis-eQTL for SERPINA6. The findings illustrated a genetic connection between CBG, plasma cortisol, and CyC, supporting the hypothesis that CyC is regulated by glucocorticoid activity.
title: Cystatin C is a glucocorticoid response gene predictive of cancer immunotherapy failure

finding: Interaction effects involving rs2144530 were reported, indicating that this variant contributes to the genetic landscape influencing serum 25OHD concentrations and their interactions with environmental factors.
title: Improved characterization of gene-environment interactions for vitamin D through variance quantitative trait loci

finding: The SNP rs2749527, located at the SERPINA1/6 locus on chromosome 14, was identified as a trans-eQTL associated with significantly reduced plasma cortisol (p=1.75e-13) and significantly reduced CST3 gene expression in visceral adipose fat in the STARNET cohort. It was independently associated with significantly reduced SERPINA6 expression in the liver. These findings suggest a genetic instrument linking cortisol, CBG, and CyC production, establishing a direct connection between glucocorticoids and cystatin C regulation.
title: Cystatin C is glucocorticoid-responsive, directs recruitment of Trem2+ macrophages and predicts failure of cancer immunotherapy

finding: This deletion variant in an intergenic region (14q12) was associated with increased risk of LA (OR: 3.38, 95% CI: 2.26, 5.07; p=3.57×10^-9).
title: Cross-ancestral GWAS identifies 29 novel variants across Head and Neck Cancer subsites

finding: <italic>GCH1</italic> rs11158026 was significantly associated with striatal binding ratios in the bilateral striatum (<italic>β</italic> = -0.16, <italic>p</italic> = 0.0002), thereby indicating its relevance to brain function in Parkinson's disease.
title: The multi-modality neuroimaging analysis identified an essential genetic variant associated with Parkinson’s disease

finding: This SNP was associated with heart failure (HF) in a significant manner, replicating its association confirmed in previous studies. It was part of the 5 of 46 SNPs that remained significant at a conservative Bonferroni-corrected replication threshold.
title: Common- and rare-variant genetic architecture of heart failure across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: SNP rs58734839 was an intronic variant in LRFN5 implicated in associations with substance use traits.
title: Multi-trait Analysis of GWAS (MTAG) of Substance Use Traits Identifies Novel Genetic Loci and Phenomic Associations

finding: The rs398652 SNP was linked to a lower risk of bladder cancer, indicating an inverse relationship with the disease.
title: A systematic review of genome-wide association studies on bladder cancer

finding: The rs115400838 variant, p.Ser185Cys in TRMT5, was linked to multiple stroke phenotypes (e.g., stroke excluding subarachnoid hemorrhage, p=1.90×10^-4), indicating its potential involvement in stroke risk.
title: Novel protein-altering variants associated with serum apolipoprotein and lipid levels

finding: The SNP rs945270 was associated with larger putamen gray matter volume and increased KTN1 expression in the frontal cortex and putamen brain regions and blood tissue. This finding suggested a significant role of rs945270 in brain structure and expression levels related to neurological health.
title: A genetic and transcriptomic assessment of the KTN1 gene in Parkinson’s disease risk

finding: SNP rs79509284 was significant with a p-value of 6.90e-8 in the putamen eQTL analysis related to ATG14, showing possible relevance in KTN1 expression and regulation.
title: A genetic and transcriptomic assessment of the KTN1 gene in Parkinson’s disease risk

finding: The lead SNP rs2887399 at the TCL1A locus was associated with an increased risk of DNMT3A-CHIP (OR = 1.14; P = 1.8 x 10^-20), highlighting its role in CHIP subtype susceptibility.
title: Exome sequencing of 628,388 individuals identifies common and rare variant associations with clonal hematopoiesis phenotypes

finding: This SNP rs11846938 was associated with an increased risk of DNMT3A-CHIP and reduced risk of TET2-CHIP (P values indicating genome-wide significance), showing subtype-specific effects.
title: Exome sequencing of 628,388 individuals identifies common and rare variant associations with clonal hematopoiesis phenotypes

finding: Similar to the previous SNPs, rs2296311 at the TCL1A locus was linked with increased risk of DNMT3A-CHIP (OR = 1.14) and protective effects against TET2-CHIP.
title: Exome sequencing of 628,388 individuals identifies common and rare variant associations with clonal hematopoiesis phenotypes

finding: In 14q11.2, rs200581586 was linked to overall macular thickness (overall_macular_thickness_right) and educational attainment, sharing genetic influences with a PPH4 of 0.764.
title: Eye-brain connections revealed by multimodal retinal and brain imaging genetics in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs4982712 showed genetic influence with educational attainment in conjunction with overall macular thickness (overall_macular_thickness_right) in 14q11.2.
title: Eye-brain connections revealed by multimodal retinal and brain imaging genetics in the UK Biobank

finding: Located in the MTA1 gene, variant rs4983416 had a frequency of 0.228 in UKB-AFR and very low frequency of 0.983 in UKB-EUR (p = 9.49 x 10<sup>-322</sup>), marking it as a significant population-specific finding.
title: Mapping Epigenetic Gene Variant Dynamics: Comparative Analysis of Frequency, Functional Impact and Trait Associations in African and European Populations

finding: SNP rs10873538 was linked to downregulation of EIF5 and PP1R13B, alongside the upregulation of KLC1. These gene expression changes were seen in the context of schizophrenia risk factors, further elucidating the genetic contributions to the disease's pathophysiology.
title: Single-cell multi-cohort dissection of the schizophrenia transcriptome

finding: The rs227422 SNP, another missense variant in the INPP5A gene, was associated with lower system segregation. This finding emphasized the role of INPP5A in calcium signaling related to cognitive functions.
title: Genetic variants link lower segregation of brain networks to higher blood pressure and worse cognition within the general aging population

finding: The rs33912345 missense variant was identified as a lead variant in the SIX6 locus associated with POAG and revealed evidence of significant interaction with variants in the CDKN2B-AS1 locus, affecting the expression of the primary cilia genes CDKN2A and CDKN2B. This interaction implicated the variant in a complex regulatory mechanism contributing to the etiology of POAG.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel ancestry-specific primary open-angle glaucoma loci and shared biology with vascular mechanisms and cell proliferation

finding: The proxy SNP rs7493429 was used for rs33912345 and demonstrated involvement in the expression of the SIX6 and SALRNA1 genes, with results indicating lower expression levels in individuals carrying the risk allele, reinforcing the association with POAG.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel ancestry-specific primary open-angle glaucoma loci and shared biology with vascular mechanisms and cell proliferation

finding: The minor allele (G) at rs365990 was significantly associated with an increase in mean heart rate and a decrease in interday heart rate variation. This variant, a missense mutation in the MYH6 gene, had previously been linked to atrial fibrillation, ventricular tachycardia, and resting heart rate abnormalities. The locus showed significant enrichment for chromatin features in heart samples, and the G allele was found to be more prevalent in the bipolar/psychotic disorder cohort compared to healthy controls, suggesting its relevance to both heart pathophysiology and psychiatric conditions.
title: Digital phenotyping from wearables using AI characterizes psychiatric disorders and identifies genetic associations

finding: The variant rs1281241634 located within LINC01500 replicated for stroke in T1D with a p-value of 0.03, further supporting the association of this locus with stroke risk.
title: Whole genome sequencing identifies rare variants in ANK1, LRRN1, HAS1, and other genes and gene regulatory regions for stroke in type 1 diabetes

finding: Served as a missense variant (p.Glu366Lys) in the SERPINA1 gene associated with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD), where it held a prominent role in fine-mapping.
title: Meta-analysis fine-mapping is often miscalibrated at single-variant resolution

finding: Identified as a missense variant (p.Pro558Thr) in RTL1, this SNP was novel for asthma and was noted for decreasing height, marking a significant contribution to the disease endpoint from the meta-analysis.
title: Meta-analysis fine-mapping is often miscalibrated at single-variant resolution

finding: Located at 14q22.2, this unique SNP was found to be associated specifically with TBS and not BMD, suggesting distinct roles in bone microarchitecture and providing insights for potential targeted interventions.
title: Genetic Determinants of Bone Microarchitecture and its Association with Health Outcomes: A Genome-wide Association and Mendelian Randomization Study on Trabecular Bone Score

finding: The SNP rs4934, a nonsynonymous variant in the SERPINA3 gene, was also reported as a potential genetic resilience factor specifically in APOE-ε4 carriers. Similar to rs10553596, it contributed to the understanding of how certain genetic variants may mitigate the impact of cumulative risk factors associated with late-onset Alzheimer's disease.
title: Polygenic resilience scores capture protective genetic effects for Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs61975852 was significantly associated with WorstEpisode symptom A2 (anhedonia) with an odds ratio of 1.07. It also had a significant association with the same PHQ9 symptom A2 (P = 0.006), indicating a correlation in the direction of effect between the two assessments.
title: Polygenic analyses show important differences between MDD symptoms collected using PHQ9 and CIDI-SF

finding: The minor allele (G) at rs365990 was significantly associated with an increase in mean heart rate and a decrease in interday heart rate variation. This missense variant in MYH6 had previously been linked to heart conditions like atrial fibrillation and ventricular tachycardia, and its association with bipolar/psychotic disorder was also noted, suggesting its relevance in both cardiac and psychiatric conditions.
title: Digital phenotyping from wearables using AI characterizes psychiatric disorders and identifies genetic associations

finding: The SNP rs28692724 was identified in association with hip circumference adjusted for body mass index (HIPadjBMI) in women (P=4.02×10^-8). This synonymous variant is located in the IRF2BPL gene, which regulates female reproductive function.
title: Genome-wide association study of body fat distribution traits in Hispanics/Latinos from the HCHS/SOL Study

finding: SNP rs28929474 was identified as potentially deleterious with a CADD score exceeding 20, suggesting its significant association with the development of both MAFLD and CAD. Its high CADD score indicated a likelihood of having harmful effects on genetic function, implicating this SNP in the shared pathophysiology of these diseases.
title: Genome-wide insights into the shared genetic landscape between metabolic dysfunction-associated fatty liver disease and cardiovascular diseases

finding: The rs115400838 SNP in TRMT5 significantly correlated with the response to idelalisib (p=4.20x10-7). It was associated with SLC38A6, a transporter potentially connected to idelalisib or its substrates.
title: Exome-wide association study reveals 7 functional variants associated with ex-vivo drug response in acute myeloid leukaemia patients

finding: The SNP was significantly associated with asthma (p = 2.6×10^-8) and implicated the RTL1 gene, known for its role in muscle regeneration.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of asthma identifies novel associations and highlights the value of increased power and diversity

finding: This SNP implicated RTL1, a novel gene linked to muscle regeneration, indicating potential new biological pathways associated with asthma.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of asthma identifies novel associations and highlights the value of increased power and diversity

finding: Identified as a novel locus with a significant association to asthma (p<sub>meta-analysis</sub> = 2.6×10<sup>−8</sup>), this SNP implicated <italic>RTL1</italic>, a gene involved in muscle regeneration.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of asthma identifies novel associations and highlights the value of increased power and diversity

finding: The variant rs148927240 near the FRMD6 gene was linked with TAA prevalence, showing a p-value of 2.19 x 10^-8 and an odds ratio of 4.23.
title: Analysis of UK Biobank Cohort Reveals Novel Insights for Thoracic and Abdominal Aortic Aneurysms

finding: Moderate selection for rs12896399 in the SLC24A4 gene was found, with an estimated selection coefficient of approximately 0.005. This SNP is significantly associated with hair color.
title: An approximate full-likelihood method for inferring selection and allele frequency trajectories from DNA sequence data

finding: The SNP rs77222982 was found within a binding motif for GATA1 and was predicted to affect its DNaseI footprint. Allelic skew was observed in GATA1 binding, confirming the predicted effect.
title: An integrated platform to systematically identify causal variants and genes for polygenic human traits

finding: The Pi-Z allele in SERPINA1 was associated with a 2.5% increase in ALT and a 1.3% increase in AST. This SNP was linked to alpha-1 antitrypsin deficiency, showcasing its relevance to liver health.
title: Genome-wide association study of circulating liver enzymes reveals an expanded role for manganese transporter SLC30A10 in liver health

finding: The finding indicated that rs4981455 was associated with miR-4707-3p expression, where the A allele was linked to increased expression. This miRNA's expression co-localized with multiple brain phenotypes, including educational attainment and brain size, highlighting its role in cortical development.
title: MicroRNA-eQTLs in the developing human neocortex link miR-4707-3p expression to brain size

finding: It was reported that rs2273626, in high linkage disequilibrium with rs4981455, affected the targeting of miR-4707-3p. The A allele was observed in allele-specific expression studies, indicating that it may alter miR-4707-3p expression or targeting, although no expression was detected in G/G genotype samples.
title: MicroRNA-eQTLs in the developing human neocortex link miR-4707-3p expression to brain size

finding: Colocalization analysis revealed that rs1043209 was linked to educational attainment and correlated with miR-4707-3p expression associations, suggesting a robust connection between these traits.
title: MicroRNA-eQTLs in the developing human neocortex link miR-4707-3p expression to brain size

finding: This SNP's alternative G allele correlated with increased H3K27ac peak height and increased gene expression of SYNE2, reinforcing its role in cardiac function and structure.
title: Disease and phenotype relevant genetic variants identified from histone acetylomes in human hearts

finding: The SNP rs8007846 was identified as associated with multiple sclerosis (MS) through a colocalization analysis involving DNA binding regions of molecular transducers such as EBNA2 and EBNA3C. It was located within a super-enhancer region derived from experiments on CD19+B cells and was shown to co-localize with these significant enhancer regions, indicating its role in transcriptional regulation linked to MS.
title: GWAS associated Variants, Non-genetic Factors, and Transient Transcriptome in Multiple Sclerosis Etiopathogenesis: a Colocalization Analysis

finding: The rs2273626 SNP in hsa-miR-4707-3p showed a significant association with a decreased risk of glaucoma, suggesting a neuroprotective role of the derived T allele. This SNP was highlighted for its extreme Fst scores (>99.98%) indicating high population differentiation, particularly with a derived allele frequency higher in non-African populations, supporting selective adaptation since the Out-of-Africa event.
title: Signatures of genetic variation in human microRNAs point to processes of positive selection related to population-specific disease risks

finding: The rs61992671 SNP was connected to gene expression variability, particularly with implications in cancer risk.
title: Signatures of genetic variation in human microRNAs point to processes of positive selection related to population-specific disease risks

finding: The SNP rs4905194 was found to be trans-associated with the gene CPEB2 in the liver, forming a single gene network under GR regulation. This network's significance was established at a 10% FDR threshold.
title: Gene networks driven by genetic variation for plasma cortisol in hepatic and adipose tissues implicate corticosteroid binding globulin in modulating tissue glucocorticoid action and cardiovascular risk

finding: The SNP rs11622665 was associated with the gene RNF13 in subcutaneous fat, representing a large network with 215 causal interactions and a significant regulatory role at a 10% FDR.
title: Gene networks driven by genetic variation for plasma cortisol in hepatic and adipose tissues implicate corticosteroid binding globulin in modulating tissue glucocorticoid action and cardiovascular risk

finding: The SNP rs8022616 was linked to the gene IRF2 in subcutaneous fat and regulated a network of 128 genes, reaching significance at a 10% FDR.
title: Gene networks driven by genetic variation for plasma cortisol in hepatic and adipose tissues implicate corticosteroid binding globulin in modulating tissue glucocorticoid action and cardiovascular risk

finding: The G206A mutation in the PSEN1 gene (SNP rs63750082) was confirmed to be a perfect imputation prediction with 100% agreement achieved in 12 individuals who were identified as carriers based on imputed genotypes. This SNP was particularly relevant in Puerto Ricans with familial early onset Alzheimer's disease (EOAD). Although the mutation was rare with an allele frequency of 0.001 in the 1000 Genomes Project (1000G) reference panel, it was absent in the Haplotype Reference Consortium (HRC) panel, which limited its imputation using HRC. The imputation quality improved significantly when the genomic region size was increased from 1MB to 5MB, boosting the IMPUTE2 'info' score from 0.48 to 0.94.
title: Rare variants imputation in admixed populations: Comparison across reference panels and bioinformatics tools

finding: The SNP rs76341705 at 14q23.1 was associated with CSA of the lingual gyrus, indicating its potential influence on cortical morphology in regions linked to visual processing.
title: Genetic Determinants of Cortical Structure (Thickness, Surface Area and Volumes) among Disease Free Adults in the CHARGE Consortium

finding: This SNV, associated with decreased CAG repeat expansion in the MLH3 region (p=4.1E-10), complements the findings of rs56375606.
title: Genetic modifiers of somatic expansion and clinical phenotypes in Huntington’s disease reveal shared and tissue-specific effects

finding: Associated with reduced MLH3 expression, though it was not independently significant in the context of the clinical GWAS.
title: Genetic modifiers of somatic expansion and clinical phenotypes in Huntington’s disease reveal shared and tissue-specific effects

finding: This SNP showed suggestive significance for hastening age at motor onset (p=6.3E-06) in the MLH3 region.
title: Genetic modifiers of somatic expansion and clinical phenotypes in Huntington’s disease reveal shared and tissue-specific effects

finding: Moderately significant (p=3.7E-06), it contributed to the analysis for age at TFC6 in the MLH3 region.
title: Genetic modifiers of somatic expansion and clinical phenotypes in Huntington’s disease reveal shared and tissue-specific effects

finding: This SNP was associated with the DICER1 gene, essential for micro-RNA processing, and downregulation was linked to several cancers.
title: Iterative feature selection method to discover predictive variables and interactions for high-dimensional transplant genomic data

finding: This SNP associated with RAD51B, involved in DNA repair and linked to several cancers, including AML.
title: Iterative feature selection method to discover predictive variables and interactions for high-dimensional transplant genomic data

finding: The SNP rs2020305 was associated with the observation that surgery could trigger the outgrowth of latent distant disease in breast cancer. This finding was significant in understanding the complexities of cancer recovery and relapse, leading to insights about the stochastic nature of cancer behaviors post-treatment.
title: The inherent fragility of collective proliferative control

finding: The variant rs1042704 in the MMP14 gene was also significantly associated with AIS, with a p-value of 1.89E-05 and an OR of 1.239 in the combined cohorts. However, this variant was not found to be significantly associated with AIS among females in stratified analysis.
title: Association of an estrogen-sensitive Pax1-Col11a1-Mmp3 signaling axis with adolescent idiopathic scoliosis

finding: The rs28711516 variant was found to be a novel predicted damaging missense variant (p.Gly56Arg) in the MYH6 gene, which encodes the α-heavy chain subunit of cardiac myosin. This locus had previously been described in relation to PR interval duration, sick sinus syndrome, atrial fibrillation, and other cardiovascular traits, thereby reinforcing its significance in cardiovascular health.
title: Multi-ancestry GWAS of the electrocardiographic PR interval identifies 210 loci underlying cardiac conduction

finding: This SNP was associated with the gene expression of AL160313.1 in proliferative smooth muscle cells, showing stronger association in males compared to females, suggesting a protective role for higher expression against atherosclerosis.
title: Genetic regulation of human aortic smooth muscle cell gene expression and splicing predict causal coronary artery disease genes

finding: The SNP rs2295682 was identified as an sQTL for the gene RBM23 across 46 tissues, notably affecting splicing patterns and the relative abundances of its isoforms in the brain cortex. Genotype differences at this locus influenced the dominance of specific isoforms, indicating a significant role in splicing regulation.
title: Identification and analysis of splicing quantitative trait loci across multiple tissues in the human genome

finding: The rs10498633 variant in the <italic>RIN3</italic> gene was linked to AD as it was in a region tagged by a significant GWAS SNP. This affiliation supported the previous associations of <italic>RIN3</italic> with Alzheimer’s disease, reinforcing the validity of genetic links in the pathogenesis of the condition.
title: Identification of novel Alzheimer’s disease genes co-expressed with TREM2

finding: The variant rs4652 in the LGALS-3 gene was associated with coronary artery disease risk in diabetic patients, emphasizing the genetic link between inflammation and CAD.
title: Identification of novel prognostic targets in coronary artery disease and related complications using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SNP rs3759601 located in the gene ATG2B was previously associated with influencing both the in-vitro and in-vivo training effects of Bacillus Calmette-Guérin (BCG) and the response to BCG in non-muscle invasive bladder cancer (NMIBC) patients from the Nijmegen Bladder Cancer Study. This SNP was specifically linked to outcomes relating to recurrence and progression after BCG therapy.
title: Intravesical BCG in patients with non-muscle invasive bladder cancer induces trained immunity and decreases respiratory infections

finding: The SNP rs12894780 was found to be associated with LIPC in a trans-interchromosomal interaction. This connection provided insights into the genetic factors involved in COPD and related traits.
title: De novo discovery of traits co-occurring with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease

finding: The variant rs2234919 (p.Pro52Thr) in the TSHR gene was linked to hyperthyroidism (p=3.6×10^-7, OR=0.74), suggesting the minor allele decreases hyperthyroidism risk.
title: Medical relevance of common protein-altering variants in GPCR genes across 337,205 individuals in the UK Biobank

finding: The rs7143400 variant was associated with Alzheimer's disease risk and implicated in altering the expression of FERMT2 by creating an 8-mer binding site for miR-4504. This variant modulated APP metabolism through decreased FERMT2 expression, particularly in individuals with the minor T allele. The down-regulation of FERMT2 by increased levels of miR-4504, observed in AD brains, was linked to increased Aβ secretion and impaired synaptic plasticity.
title: Alzheimer’s genetic risk factor FERMT2 (Kindlin-2) is regulated by risk allele-binding of miR-4504 and leads to synaptic dysfunction in an APP-dependent manner

finding: The SNP rs2242542 G/A affected the splice acceptor site of the TRAV26-2 V exon. The presence of the 'A' variant removed the splice site, which was noted to occur at a high frequency of 29.1% in the 1KGP cases.
title: Archaic humans have contributed to large-scale variation in modern human T cell receptor genes

finding: Found in TRAV19, rs17113205 is a stop codon variant contributing to transcriptional failure or expression loss within the TCR repertoire.
title: Archaic humans have contributed to large-scale variation in modern human T cell receptor genes

finding: This stop codon SNP variant was identified in TRAV34, highlighting genetic variants that resulted in TCR expression loss.
title: Archaic humans have contributed to large-scale variation in modern human T cell receptor genes

finding: This SNP variant was located within the recombination signal sequence of TRAJ12, leading to frequent hemizygous or homozygous expression loss in African individuals.
title: Archaic humans have contributed to large-scale variation in modern human T cell receptor genes

finding: The AAGT deletion variant rs3841038 removed the splice donor site of TRAJ17, correlating with hemizygous and homozygous loss of expression.
title: Archaic humans have contributed to large-scale variation in modern human T cell receptor genes

finding: This SNP was associated with low level expression of a shortened TRAJ52 sequence, suggesting altered functional TCR designs driven by genetic variants.
title: Archaic humans have contributed to large-scale variation in modern human T cell receptor genes

finding: This SNP variant was linked to the TRAJ44 allele found in 2 of 11 African individuals, illustrating population-specific allelic absence.
title: Archaic humans have contributed to large-scale variation in modern human T cell receptor genes

finding: This SNP was associated with eGFR in admixture mapping within the chromosome 14 locus and was validated in WHI AAs, showing a beta coefficient of -0.04 and a P-value of 2.2 x 10^-2, indicating European ancestry conferred a decrease in eGFR.
title: Genome-wide admixture mapping of eGFR and CKD identify European and African ancestry-of-origin loci in U.S. Hispanics/Latinos

finding: Like rs6575805, this SNP was found associated with eGFR in the admixture mapping, validated in the WHI AAs, showing similarly that European ancestry reduced eGFR with a P-value of 0.03.
title: Genome-wide admixture mapping of eGFR and CKD identify European and African ancestry-of-origin loci in U.S. Hispanics/Latinos

finding: The SNP rs144567652, identified as a FANCM c.5791C>T nonsense mutation, resulted in exon skipping which impaired DNA repair activity. This mutation was associated with an increased familial risk for breast cancer. The findings highlighted the critical role of FANCM in DNA repair processes relevant to cancer susceptibility.
title: FANCM regulates repair pathway choice at stalled replication forks

finding: The sequence variant rs7155603, located upstream of the human Batf gene, was associated with a higher risk of rheumatoid arthritis. This finding related to IFN I-mediated pathologies, highlighting the role of BATF in autoimmune diseases where IFN I is considered a driving factor.
title: BATF controls IFN I production via DC-SCRIPT in plasmacytoid dendritic cells

finding: The SNP rs2296651 was found to be associated with variability in the hepatitis B virus preS1 protein. In the study conducted by Casillas et al. (2018), the prevalence of this polymorphism was analyzed within a Spanish population, indicating a significant role of rs2296651 in the variability of hepatitis B virus, which could have implications for protein interactions based on the described characteristics of NTCP and DBP-MAF.
title: Significance of hydrophobic and charged sequence similarities in sodium-bile acid cotransporter and vitamin D-binding protein macrophage activating factor

finding: This SNP showed associations in ADHD related to SA, indicating its importance in brain structure.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: The SNP rs10142766 exhibited associations with greater CT in MDD, indicating its role in psychiatric-related anatomical features.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: This SNP was linked to increased CT of supramarginal cortex in MDD, establishing connections with cortical anatomy.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: The rs229188 variant in CYP51A1 was linked to the genetics of aging in women, highlighting its potential impact on metabolic phenotypes related to aging and cancer risk.
title: Sex-dependent pathways in hepatocarcinogenesis triggered by deregulated cholesterol synthesis

finding: The SNP rs150526114 was identified as a tag SNP within a smaller linkage disequilibrium (LD) block that showed the greatest allele frequency differences. It segregated at a frequency of 91% in CDX, 73% in KHV, and 59% in CHS, but was rare or absent in most other global populations, including those from the 1000 Genomes Project. Its global minor allele matched sequences observed in Neanderthal genomes, indicating a potential Neanderthal-introgressed origin and its role in positive selection among Southeast Asian populations.
title: Local adaptation and archaic introgression shape global diversity at human structural variant loci

finding: The rs28929474 SNP, identified as the Pi-Z allele in the SERPINA1 gene, was linked to alpha-1 antitrypsin deficiency (AATD), resulting in a 2.5% increase in ALT and a 1.3% increase in AST.
title: Genome-wide association study of circulating liver enzymes reveals an expanded role for manganese transporter SLC30A10 in liver health

finding: This SNP was associated with an upregulation of L1 family genes, indicating its involvement in the regulation of transposable elements, despite being categorized as an orphan index SNV.
title: An eQTL-based Approach Reveals Candidate Regulators of LINE-1 RNA Levels in Lymphoblastoid Cells

finding: The SNP rs72680543 in the 5' region of BMP4 showed a significant association with a p-value of 0.043. However, this SNP was in complete linkage disequilibrium with two other non-significant SNPs, indicating that while it was identified in the study, further investigations were not pursued due to the lack of strong supporting evidence.
title: Mutation in the Bone Morphogenetic Protein signaling pathway sensitize zebrafish and human to ethanol-induced jaw malformations

finding: The variant rs2887399 was shown to be associated with higher expression of the TCL1A gene in blood, where the LOY risk-increasing allele was linked to significant upregulation of TCL1A exclusively in B-lymphocytes, thus relating gene expression to clonal mosaicism.
title: Genetic predisposition to mosaic Y chromosome loss in blood is associated with genomic instability in other tissues and susceptibility to non-haematological cancers

finding: The study identified the SNP rs2738413 located in the <italic>SYNE2</italic>-AF region as being associated with atrial fibrillation (AF). This SNP was found to correlate with lower expression of the <italic>SYNE2</italic> gene in atrial tissue, indicating its potential role in cardiac regulation.
title: Systematic in vivo interrogation identifies novel enhancers and silencers associated to Atrial Fibrillation

finding: Similar to rs2738413, the SNP rs1152591 was associated with AF risk and was located in the <italic>SYNE2</italic>-AF region. It also correlated with expression levels of the <italic>SYNE2</italic> gene in the human atria, linking it to the regulation of AF.
title: Systematic in vivo interrogation identifies novel enhancers and silencers associated to Atrial Fibrillation

finding: Associated with multiple coronary artery disease-related traits, reinforcing its significance in cardiovascular genetics.
title: A method to map and interpret pleiotropic loci using summary statistics of multiple traits

finding: The variant rs28929474 (the Pi-Z allele) in SERPINA1 was found to cause a 2.5% increase in ALT and a 1.3% increase in AST, which relates to alpha-1 antitrypsin deficiency presenting with liver damage.
title: GWAS of serum ALT and AST reveals an association of SLC30A10 Thr95Ile with hypermanganesemia symptoms

finding: The SNP rs7160525 was linked to CER[N(24)S(16)] and identified as having significant associations with hematological phenotypes, implicating its role in the metabolism of ceramide species relevant to blood cell counts.
title: Heritability and family-based GWAS analyses of the N-acyl ethanolamine and ceramide lipidome reveal genetic influence over circulating lipids

finding: The SNP rs7157785 in the SGPP1 gene was newly associated with CER[N(24)S(16)], contributing further evidence of the gene's role in ceramide metabolism and its ties to various blood lipid levels.
title: Heritability and family-based GWAS analyses of the N-acyl ethanolamine and ceramide lipidome reveal genetic influence over circulating lipids

finding: The schizophrenia-associated variant rs1191551 was found to interact with the FOXG1 promoter through significant promoter-PIR interactions. This interaction was recapitulated in both hippocampal dentate gyrus-like neurons and astrocytes, highlighting its relevance in the broader context of genetic interactions in neurological disorders.
title: cis-Regulatory Chromatin Contacts in Neural Cells Reveal Contributions of Genetic Variants to Complex Neurological Disorders

finding: The variant was highlighted as a contact eQTL affecting CTCF binding, leading to decreased enhancer-promoter contact and anomalous PCK2 expression across multiple studies.
title: Shared and distinct molecular effects of regulatory genetic variants provide insight into mechanisms of distal enhancer-promoter communication

finding: The SNP rs7148456 in the BAG5 locus was subjected to base editing using a deactivated Cas9 (dCas9) approach, achieving editing efficiencies of 11.2% and 13.8% in low and high polygenic risk score (PRS) hiPSC lines respectively. This finding underscored the potential for allele-specific chromatin modifications that may influence schizophrenia susceptibility.
title: Publicly available hiPSC lines with extreme polygenic risk scores for modeling schizophrenia

finding: The SNP rs8020128 was associated with seasonal variation in the NDVI–species richness relationship in a prairie grassland experiment, indicating its relevance to ecological impacts studied in relation to both atmospheric and soil drought treatments in the context of plant community responses.
title: Simulating atmospheric drought: Silica gel packets dehumidify mesocosm microclimates

finding: SNP rs999737 was previously reported in relation to breast cancer risk and remained significant after applying the DOT method in the analysis.
title: DOT: Gene-set analysis by combining decorrelated association statistics

finding: Analysis pointed to this SNP as another new association arising from the investigation into RAD51B's contribution to breast cancer.
title: DOT: Gene-set analysis by combining decorrelated association statistics

finding: The study investigated the rs8005161 polymorphism which influenced the activation of the G protein-coupled receptor GPR65 (TDAG8) under pH-associated conditions in the context of intestinal inflammation. This finding indicated a significant relationship between this SNP and the receptor's physiological responsiveness, suggesting its role in the pathophysiology of inflammatory responses.
title: Activation of a nerve injury transcriptional signature in airway-innervating sensory neurons after lipopolysaccharide induced lung inflammation

finding: The variant rs61745752 was identified as a rare natural variant of the GPR68 gene, which resulted in a c-terminal truncation of the protein (E336X). It was associated with an odds ratio of approximately 3 for secondary malignancies including bone metastasis, liver metastasis, and 4.9 for 'acquired absence of breast,' suggestive of breast cancer surgery. Among 70 carriers of this variant in the BioVU cohort, 11.4% had a diagnosis of malignant neoplasm of breast and 5.7% had malignant breast cancer with metastasis to either bone or liver, compared to 4.6% and 1.1% respectively in non-carriers. This evidence indicated that rs61745752 could be a risk variant for the metastatic potential of various cancer types, specifically influencing tumor aggressiveness in breast cancer.
title: Coupling metastasis to pH sensing G Protein-coupled receptor-68 through first in class inhibitor identified in an in vivo chemical genetic screen

finding: The rs2239633 polymorphism was found in the promoter region of the CEBPE gene, which showed accessibility throughout B-cell differentiation and was associated with increased expression in ETV6-RUNX1 and hyperdiploid BCP ALL cases. This indicated potential relevance for B-ALL susceptibility despite existing debates.
title: Uncovering the cis-regulatory program of early human B-cell commitment and its implications in the pathogenesis of B-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia

finding: The SNP rs945270 was associated with cerebral gray matter volumes and attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD). This finding was elaborated within a study that reported sex-differentiated interrelationships of the SNP with brain structure and function, highlighting differences across male and female participants.
title: Longitudinal sex-at-birth and age analyses of cortical structure in the ABCD Study®

finding: The rs12890411 SNP was linked to breast tissue and several cancer eQTLs. Found within intron 5 of the NOXRED1 gene, it was associated with a 20 percentile decrease in enhancer activity. The alternative allele diminished the predicted binding strength of the RELA protein, which is crucial for binding to the wild-type enhancer. Consequently, individuals carrying the alternative allele exhibited reduced expression levels of NOXRED1 gene, consistent with Pancan data.
title: Mechanistic analysis of enhancer sequences in the Estrogen Receptor transcriptional program

finding: Identified in the context of RDE11 in RPE1 through single-cell TWAS, highlighting its significance in geographic atrophy.
title: Transcriptomic and proteomic retinal pigment epithelium signatures of age-related macular degeneration

finding: The SNP rs72680543 in the 5’ region of BMP4 was significant with regard to mandible volume, showing a p-value of 0.043, indicating it might relate to gene-ethanol interactions influencing facial development, despite being in complete linkage disequilibrium with non-significant SNPs.
title: Mutation in the Bone Morphogenetic Protein signaling pathway sensitize zebrafish and human to ethanol-induced jaw malformations

finding: This SNP was found to coincide with GWAS peaks for autoimmune diseases such as ulcerative colitis, disrupting critical transcription factor motifs.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: The variant was identified as likely causal for the SYNE2 gene and was associated with an atrial fibrillation GWAS signal, indicating a specific role in cardiac muscle.
title: Fine mapping spatiotemporal mechanisms of genetic variants underlying cardiac traits and disease

finding: The SNP rs217669 on human chromosome 14, linked to the gene SYT16, showed synteny with a region in the mouse genome involved in a cluster of interactions, which may suggest its potential role in obesity regulation.
title: Genome-wide analysis of promoter contacts identifies novel regulators of late-stage adipogenesis

finding: The study reported that the rs8005161 polymorphism impacted the G protein-coupled receptor GPR65 (TDAG8), which was related to pH-associated activation in the context of intestinal inflammation. The findings suggested a significant connection between this SNP and the modulation of inflammatory responses in the intestine, providing insights into its role in conditions such as ulcerative colitis.
title: Mapping multicellular programs from single-cell profiles

finding: The SNP rs10130373 was identified within a microglia-specific peak in the SLC24A4 locus. It disrupted an SPI1 motif and communicated with the promoter of the RIN3 gene, implicating a role in microglial function relevant to AD.
title: Single-cell epigenomic identification of inherited risk loci in Alzheimer’s and Parkinson’s disease

finding: An association was identified between rs2234919 in TSHR and hyperthyroidism (p=3.6×10⁻⁷, OR=0.74, 95% CI: 0.66-0.83). This finding was consistent with previous studies that reported conflicting results regarding this allele.
title: Medical relevance of common protein-altering variants in GPCR genes across 337,205 individuals in the UK Biobank study

finding: The rs2075797 SNP in the PTGER2 gene was identified to be associated with COPD risk in the same Tunisian cohort, supporting its relevance in the pathogenesis of the disease.
title: Identification of key genes and biological pathways in chronic obstructive pulmonary disease using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The genotype at rs11846556 was significantly associated with an increase in the risk of chronic pain, where each additional copy of the A allele increased the odds of having chronic pain by 2% (OR = 1.02). However, it was not significantly associated with major depressive disorder (MDD), suggesting pleiotropy mediated by chronic pain.
title: Identification of novel common variants associated with chronic pain using conditional false discovery rate analysis with major depressive disorder and assessment of pleiotropic effects of LRFN5

finding: An intronic single nucleotide polymorphism (rs1049468267) within the FBLN5 gene was linked to 'cerebral atherosclerosis' and 'occlusion and stenosis of precerebral arteries' in a phenome-wide association analysis involving white British participants of the UK Biobank. The findings indicated a strong association between fibulin 5 and cerebral artery diseases, and they suggested that dysregulation of fibulin 5 in cerebral arteries at early-onset hypertension could increase the risk of certain cerebrovascular diseases related to hypertension.
title: Proteomic mapping reveals dysregulated angiogenesis in the cerebral arteries of rats with early-onset hypertension

finding: The rs1063271 variant found in the 3' UTR of the SPTLC2 gene was associated with poorer exercise responses. The variant likely impacted transcript stability and sphingolipid biosynthesis, leading to mitochondrial dysfunction.
title: Identification of novel mitochondrial and mitochondrial related genetic loci associated with exercise response in the Gene SMART study

finding: The SNP rs72680543 in the 5’ region of BMP4 was significant (p=0.043) and was in complete linkage disequilibrium with two other non-significant SNPs, prompting no further investigation in BMP4.
title: Mutations in the Bone Morphogenetic Protein signaling pathway sensitize zebrafish and humans to ethanol-induced jaw malformations

finding: The A allele of rs1950834 was identified as a protective variant against major depressive disorder (MDD). This protective mechanism was linked to the reduction of chromatin accessibility due to disrupted binding of transcription factor ETV1, which led to a decreased expression of the lncRNA AL121821.1 in neural progenitor cells.
title: Genetic regulation of lncRNA expression in the whole human brain

finding: The variant rs28711516 (p.Gly56Arg) was identified as a novel predicted damaging missense variant in the MYH6 gene. MYH6 was already known to be associated with the PR interval, sick sinus syndrome, atrial fibrillation (AF), and other cardiovascular traits, making this finding a significant contribution to existing knowledge about its role in cardiovascular disease.
title: Multi-ancestry GWAS of the electrocardiographic PR interval identifies 210 loci underlying cardiac conduction

finding: The SNP rs12588974 was found to be indicative of the IGHV1-2*01 or IGHV1-2*05 alleles. This variant exhibited a presence of approximately 5% in European populations, suggesting a low but significant frequency of these alleles.
title: Poorly expressed alleles of several human immunoglobulin heavy chain variable (IGHV) genes are common in the human population

finding: The study found rs7161194, located approximately 1.8 kb upstream of the MIR541 gene, to be significantly associated with higher plasma HDL-C levels, suggesting a potential role of the MIR541 locus in regulating HDL cholesterol.
title: MicroRNA-541-3p alters lipoproteins to reduce atherosclerosis by degrading Znf101 and Casz1 transcription factors

finding: The H3309R substitution in nesprin-2 was associated with Emery-Dreifuss muscular dystrophy and was correlated with the expression of the tumor suppressor cyclin-dependent kinase inhibitor 1 (CDK1/p21) in HBV-related hepatocellular carcinomas.
title: Peptide Ancestry Informative Markers in Uterine Neoplasms from Women of European, African and Asian Ancestry

finding: The cQTL variant rs7146599 was shown to disrupt a CTCF binding motif affecting chromatin insulation at the PCK2 locus, inversely impacting contact profiles and associating with increased PCK2 expression across multiple eQTL studies.
title: Shared and distinct molecular effects of regulatory genetic variants provide insight into mechanisms of distal enhancer-promoter communication

finding: The SNP rs217669 was located near the gene SYT16 and was associated with a cluster of distal interactions with a non-coding RNA, indicating its potential involvement in obesity-related mechanisms.
title: Genome-wide analysis of promoter contacts identifies novel regulators of late-stage adipogenesis

finding: Also replicated in the largest BMI meta GWAS, this SNP showed a significant finding with a p-value of 1.3e-17.
title: Quantitative Genetic Scoring, or how to put a number on an arbitrary genetic region

finding: The locus rs2296312 colocalized with a TCL1A eQTL in whole blood (PPH4=0.714) and showed significant associations with telomere length as the effect size increased with age, highlighting the SNP's relevance in aging and telomere dynamics.
title: Validation of human telomere length trans-ancestry meta-analysis association signals identifies POP5 and KBTBD6 as novel human telomere length regulation genes

finding: The RAD51B gene SNP, rs999737, was shown to potentially confer risk for breast cancer through the analysis's application of the DOT method.
title: DOT: Gene-set analysis by combining decorrelated association statistics

finding: rs7359088 was indicated as a new potential association with breast cancer risk within RAD51B, according to the DOT method.
title: DOT: Gene-set analysis by combining decorrelated association statistics

finding: This SNP was associated with the gene GON7, also replicated in the largest BMI meta-GWAS (p=1.3e-17), indicating a strong association with obesity.
title: Quantitative Genetic Scoring, or how to put a number on an arbitrary genetic region

finding: This SNP was linked to multiple sclerosis (MS) and systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) and was found to alter the binding affinity of FOSL2 to DNA.
title: The AP-1 factors FOSL1 and FOSL2 co-regulate human Th17 responses

finding: This SNP was associated with multiple sclerosis (MS) and rheumatoid arthritis (RA), affecting the binding ability of FOSL2 significantly.
title: The AP-1 factors FOSL1 and FOSL2 co-regulate human Th17 responses

finding: The study highlighted that components of the hedgehog (Hh) signaling pathway were decreased in aged macrophages across multiple tissues, suggesting a connection with rs8020022. In vivo suppression of Hh signaling in young animals was found to increase the expression of pro-inflammatory cytokines, indicating the relevance of this SNP in age-related inflammation pathways and its potential as a target for mitigating age-associated diseases.
title: Hedgehog dysregulation contributes to tissue-specific inflammaging of resident macrophages

finding: This variant exhibited ATU regulatory effects specifically in the PRMT5-AS1 gene in naive CD4+ T cells.
title: Variant-to-function dissection of rare non-coding GWAS loci with high impact on blood traits

finding: Located in an intergenic region on chromosome 14, rs61983410 was associated with microalbuminuria (full model OR = 0.78, P = 3.06×10^-8), emphasizing significant genetic contributions to albumin levels in renal disease.
title: Genome-wide association study of diabetic kidney disease highlights biology involved in renal basement membrane collagen

finding: The SNP rs55883101 was highlighted as a significant example in the study where it received the highest number of merged RefSNPs, totaling 42 merged records. This SNP exemplified how the SPDI model and NCBI Variant Overprecision Correction algorithm facilitated the grouping of variants and reduced redundancy within the dbSNP database.
title: SPDI: Data Model for Variants and Applications at NCBI

finding: rs10139547 was included among the novel SNPs related to MS and CD, highlighting its relevance in the study of genetic interactions between these diseases.
title: Investigating the shared genetic architecture between multiple sclerosis and inflammatory bowel diseases

finding: The SNP rs11158812 was identified as a significant deQTL in NK cells for GZMH, indicating its regulatory role within this specific immune cell type and showing significant association with gene expression patterns.
title: Genetic variants associated with cell-type-specific intra-individual gene expression variability reveal new mechanisms of genome regulation

finding: This SNP showed associations with two traits in opposite directions, reinforcing its potential role in trait modulation.
title: Multivariate Genomewide Association Analysis with IHT

finding: This SNP's risk allele was found to have significantly lower transcriptional activity compared to the normal allele in LNCaP cells, again indicating a negative regulatory effect.
title: A dinucleotide tag-based parallel reporter gene assay method

finding: This SNP showed a significant association with TRAV26-2, with a beta of -1.035 and a P-value of 4.88 x 10^−27 after correction for multiple testing. This indicates genetic determinants influencing clonal usage of this TCR alpha gene.
title: Defining the genetic determinants of CD8+ T cell receptor repertoire in the context of immune checkpoint blockade

finding: The SNP rs12889775 exhibited a strong colocalisation with the expression of multiple genes, specifically IRF2BPL and the lncRNA RP11-7F17.7. Its predicted impact formed through the alteration of EGR1 binding affinity, with a posterior probability of shared association p_H4=0.997, indicating a robust link to gene expression.
title: Functional effects of variation in transcription factor binding highlight long-range gene regulation by epromoters

finding: The variant rs80168986 had a positive original finding related to its role in diminishing mRNA polyadenylation. Borzoi indicated that this G>A change created a new HNRNPA1 binding motif, which led to decreased polyadenylation of RNA transcripts, thereby affecting gene expression and processing.
title: Predicting RNA-seq coverage from DNA sequence as a unifying model of gene regulation

finding: The SNP rs11158026 was associated with GCH1 and was demonstrated to have significant expression in dopaminergic neuron samples, making it a relevant candidate for PD research.
title: Single cell spatial transcriptomic and translatomic profiling of dopaminergic neurons in health, ageing and disease

finding: This SNP was located within the promoter region of the CEBPE gene and was associated with increased expression in cases of ETV6-RUNX1 and hyperdiploid BCP ALL. The promoter region was accessible throughout B cell differentiation, providing evidence linking it to susceptibility to B-ALL.
title: Uncovering the cis-regulatory program of early human B-cell commitment and its implications in the pathogenesis of B-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia

finding: For SNP rs72691418, significant upregulation of the L1 family gene set was observed (NES = 4.01, FDR = 5.38E-79), indicating its association with transposon expression control.
title: A Computational Approach for the Identification of Novel L1 Transcriptional Regulators

finding: The SNP rs1152591 was identified as a significant cis-eQTL for SYNE2 gene expression, with the risk allele associated with lower expression of the SYNE2α1 isoform. This SNP, located 11 bp upstream of the SYNE2α1 transcription start site, was linked to increased risks of Atrial Fibrillation (AF). RNA sequencing and qPCR analyses in human left atrial appendage (LAA) tissues showed a statistically significant decrease in SYNE2α1 expression among carriers of the risk alleles.
title: Atrial fibrillation associated common risk variants in SYNE2 lead to lower expression of nesprin-2α1 and increased nuclear stiffness

finding: SNP rs1152595 was identified as the strongest cis-eQTL for the SYNE2α1 isoform expression, with the risk alleles associated with decreased SYNE2α1 levels. Though it was located 6,128 bp upstream of the SYNE2α1 transcription start site, it demonstrated an r2 value of 0.78 and a D’ of 1 in linkage disequilibrium with rs1152591. The analysis confirmed a linear trend showing lower SYNE2α1 expression in subjects with risk alleles.
title: Atrial fibrillation associated common risk variants in SYNE2 lead to lower expression of nesprin-2α1 and increased nuclear stiffness

finding: The SNP rs10147988 was associated with differential allelic RNA-seq counts in neurons, indicating its involvement in regulating gene expression at the MEG3 locus, which is relevant in the context of imprinted gene clusters.
title: Inference of cell-type specific imprinted regulatory elements and genes during human neuronal differentiation

finding: The SNP rs12879413 also corresponded with differential allelic RNA-seq counts in neurons, suggesting similar regulatory roles at the MEG8 locus within imprinted gene regions.
title: Inference of cell-type specific imprinted regulatory elements and genes during human neuronal differentiation

finding: The SNP rs1802710 demonstrated progenitor-specific imprinting expressions related to the DLK1 locus, highlighting its significance in the imprinting landscape related to Kagami Ogata syndrome and its association with copy number variations.
title: Inference of cell-type specific imprinted regulatory elements and genes during human neuronal differentiation

finding: Similarly recognized in the 2013 GWAS that assessed the genetic risk for Alzheimer's disease among a substantial sample size, supporting its association with the disease.
title: Multi-Modal Data Analysis for Alzheimer’s Disease Diagnosis: An Ensemble Model Using Imagery and Genetic Features

finding: As part of the findings in the 2013 GWAS study, this SNP was classified as a significant risk factor for Alzheimer's disease.

finding: This SNP was associated with SNVs in the 3’ UTR of FOXA1, with strong evidence of replication.

finding: The SNP rs12896399 in the SLC24A4 gene demonstrated significant differences between West Africans and Eurasians, suggesting a selection signal tied to dark pigmentation.

finding: The gene closest to rs11158026 was shown to have specific and enriched expression in DA neurons, suggesting a connection to the mechanisms of Parkinson's disease.
title: Single cell spatial transcriptomic and translatomic profiling of dopaminergic neurons in health, ageing and disease

finding: This SNP was associated with lower levels of ENTPD5 and revealed a protective effect against type 2 diabetes and diabetic kidney disease, showcasing its relevance in metabolic disease risk.

finding: Linked with ENTPD5, the SNP rs140111715 demonstrated robust associations with decreased protein levels that correlated with lower risks of type 2 diabetes and related kidney complications.
