finding: Associated with the consumption of pieces of fresh fruit per day as well as pieces of dried fruit per day, this SNP was found on chromosome 14q with a significance of P=5.1×10^-24.
title: Comprehensive genomic analysis of dietary habits in UK Biobank identifies hundreds of genetic loci and establishes causal relationships between educational attainment and healthy eating

finding: This SNP was linked to the consumption of pieces of dried fruit per day in addition to pieces of fresh fruit per day, located in a region on chromosome 14q with a significance of P=6.4×10^-18.
title: Comprehensive genomic analysis of dietary habits in UK Biobank identifies hundreds of genetic loci and establishes causal relationships between educational attainment and healthy eating

finding: This SNP was associated with the consumption of tablespoons of raw vegetables per day, found to be significant with P=4.1×10^-10, and overlaps with olfactory receptor gene OR4K17.
title: Comprehensive genomic analysis of dietary habits in UK Biobank identifies hundreds of genetic loci and establishes causal relationships between educational attainment and healthy eating

finding: The SNP rs1263872 was associated with reduced antimicrobial activity in the context of Ribonuclease 7, as reported in a study focused on pediatric urinary tract infections. This finding highlighted the significance of the SNP in influencing immune responses, particularly in relation to susceptibility to infections.
title: A suite of selective pressures supports the maintenance of alleles of a Drosophila immune peptide

finding: The rs3825761 SNP colocalized with an eQTL signal associated with the NUDT14 gene and was involved in inducing a splice junction that introduced a premature stop codon. This resulted in a longer 3' UTR transcript susceptible to NMD, impacting the expression levels of NUDT14 in the context of reticulocyte count GWAS signals.
title: Global impact of aberrant splicing on human gene expression levels

finding: Linked to precuneus surface area, rs73313052 was associated with eQTLs for DACT1 and DAAM1 in contexts of synapse formation, reflecting its role in cortical development.
title: The genetic architecture of the human cerebral cortex

finding: The SNP rs59228823 was linked to MEG3, a gene with fibroblast-specific expression, showcasing the potential regulatory effect of this enhancer SNP-gene interaction on fibroblast-associated vascular functions.
title: Chromatin interaction maps of human arterioles reveal new mechanisms for the genetic regulation of blood pressure

finding: The SNP rs4144266 was reported as an independent genetic marker with significant association to eye colour, displaying notable effects on pigmentation traits.
title: Investigating the genetic architecture of eye colour in a Canadian cohort

finding: The SNP was recognized for having considerable evidence in the SLC24A4 locus, correlating with pigmentation variation in eye colour.
title: Investigating the genetic architecture of eye colour in a Canadian cohort

finding: The CYP46A1 SNP rs754203 was correlated with increased plasma levels of 24S-hydroxycholesterol and was implicated in cognitive impairment linked with type 2 diabetes, providing context on its broader metabolic effects.
title: Identification of differentially expressed genes and signaling pathways in gestational diabetes mellitus by integrated bioinformatics analysis

finding: The SNP rs781779034 was modeled in yeast, exhibiting a null-like phenotype for mismatch repair (MMR) and crossing over defects. This finding indicated the SNP's potential impact on meiotic processes.
title: MLH1/3 variants causing aneuploidy, pregnancy loss, and premature reproductive aging

finding: SNP rs138006166 demonstrated similar characteristics to rs781779034, also showing null-like or intermediate phenotypes for MMR and crossing over defects, confirming its detrimental role in meiotic function.
title: MLH1/3 variants causing aneuploidy, pregnancy loss, and premature reproductive aging

finding: Like the other two SNPs, rs781739661 was implicated in null-like or intermediate phenotypes for MMR and crossing over, contributing to the understanding of its potential impact on reproductive health.
title: MLH1/3 variants causing aneuploidy, pregnancy loss, and premature reproductive aging

finding: The SNP rs746927118 was classified as deleterious and identified during the investigation of the ATL1 gene. It was related to hereditary spastic paraplegia type 3A (SPG3A) and was noted for impacting the ATL1 protein function.
title: Extensive In Silico Analysis of ATL1 Gene: Discovered Five Mutations that may Cause Hereditary Spastic Paraplegia Type 3A

finding: The SNP rs979765709 was identified as deleterious in the analysis of the ATL1 gene. This finding held significance for hereditary spastic paraplegia type 3A (SPG3A), suggesting its impact on the function of the ATL1 protein.
title: Extensive In Silico Analysis of ATL1 Gene: Discovered Five Mutations that may Cause Hereditary Spastic Paraplegia Type 3A

finding: The SNP rs119476049 was classified as a deleterious mutation in the ATL1 gene, with implications for hereditary spastic paraplegia type 3A (SPG3A) through its functional effect on the ATL1 protein.
title: Extensive In Silico Analysis of ATL1 Gene: Discovered Five Mutations that may Cause Hereditary Spastic Paraplegia Type 3A

finding: The SNP rs864622269 was identified as deleterious, contributing to the functional disruption of the ATL1 protein, and was relevant for hereditary spastic paraplegia type 3A (SPG3A).
title: Extensive In Silico Analysis of ATL1 Gene: Discovered Five Mutations that may Cause Hereditary Spastic Paraplegia Type 3A

finding: The SNP rs1242753115 was classified as deleterious in the context of the ATL1 gene, impacting the function of the ATL1 protein and having relevance for hereditary spastic paraplegia type 3A (SPG3A).
title: Extensive In Silico Analysis of ATL1 Gene: Discovered Five Mutations that may Cause Hereditary Spastic Paraplegia Type 3A

finding: An association was identified with heart disease traits at this intronic SNP located in the HHIPL1 gene on 14q32.2.
title: A method to map and interpret pleiotropic loci using summary statistics of multiple traits

finding: The SNP rs8010004 was linked to regulatory functions in telomerase activity through its correlation with hTERT gene transcription. The study indicated that the ZCCHC10-PITX1 complex, which was affected by the presence of rs8010004, played a significant role in suppressing hTERT transcription in melanoma cell lines, implicating its involvement in cancer development.
title: PITX1 protein interacts with ZCCHC10 to regulate hTERT mRNA transcription

finding: The SNP rs8007846, located on chromosome 14, was identified as significantly associated with multiple sclerosis (MS). It colocalized with DNA binding regions identified as a super-enhancer from CD19+ B cells and was part of a colocalization analysis that highlighted regions coding for the transient transcriptome. This finding suggested that the TT-coding regions are critical convergence points for both genetic and non-genetic factors influencing MS risk.
title: GWAS associated Variants, Non-genetic Factors, and Transient Transcriptome in Multiple Sclerosis Etiopathogenesis: a Colocalization Analysis

finding: The rs201076896 mutation, along with three others (rs201691548, rs200931578, and rs202166511), was linked to an increased risk of rheumatic heart disease (RHD) particularly in Oceanic populations. This study characterized these polymorphisms within a population-matched database revealing the highest frequencies in African populations, suggesting a greater prevalence of RHD in these groups.
title: Population matched (PM) germline allelic variants of immunoglobulin (IG) loci: New pmIG database to better understand IG repertoire and selection processes in disease and vaccination

finding: Similar to rs201076896, the rs201691548 SNP was involved in the increased susceptibility to RHD, contributing alongside three other alleles to the disease risk. Its frequency was observed to be highest in African populations, indicating a potential regional health disparity.
title: Population matched (PM) germline allelic variants of immunoglobulin (IG) loci: New pmIG database to better understand IG repertoire and selection processes in disease and vaccination

finding: The rs200931578 SNP was part of the group linked to higher susceptibility to RHD, showing significant presence in the population-matched database. Its association with higher frequencies in African populations further emphasized the findings regarding RHD prevalence in these communities.
title: Population matched (PM) germline allelic variants of immunoglobulin (IG) loci: New pmIG database to better understand IG repertoire and selection processes in disease and vaccination

finding: The rs202166511 SNP was identified as one of the four polymorphisms associated with increased RHD risk. The profiling highlighted its elevated frequency within African populations, consistent with observations made for the other RHD-related SNPs.
title: Population matched (PM) germline allelic variants of immunoglobulin (IG) loci: New pmIG database to better understand IG repertoire and selection processes in disease and vaccination

finding: The variant rs2253317 at chr14:68585686:G:C demonstrated beta cell-specific effects on a cRE intronic to the RAD51B gene, showcasing unique regulatory roles in beta cells.
title: Single cell multiome profiling of pancreatic islets reveals physiological changes in cell type-specific regulation associated with diabetes risk

finding: SNP rs3742943 was linked to gene JAG2, known to be involved in embryonic development and related to fatal diseases.
title: Locating suspicious lethal genes by abnormal distributions of SNP patterns

finding: The SNP rs160458 was found to be significantly associated with the geodesic depth of the left superior temporal asymmetrical pit (STAP) phenotype. It exhibited a strong association in the UK Biobank British discovery sample with a p-value of 2.0 × 10^-12, supporting its relevance in the anatomical features of the temporal cortex related to language processing.
title: A DACT1 enhancer modulates brain asymmetric temporal regions involved in language processing

finding: The SNP rs160459 demonstrated a significant association with the STAP phenotypes, particularly the depth of the left STAP, with a p-value of 4.2 × 10^-12 in the UK Biobank. It regulated the gene DACT1, which is crucial for the structural and functional characteristics of the superior temporal regions involved in language. The effect of this SNP was particularly pronounced during gestation, highlighting its role in the developmental aspects of language-related neural structures.
title: A DACT1 enhancer modulates brain asymmetric temporal regions involved in language processing

finding: The rs1957757 polymorphism in the HIF-1alpha gene was found to interact with CpG island methylation in the promoter region, which was associated with an increased risk of anti-tuberculosis drug-induced liver injury. This finding highlighted the genetic susceptibility factors that contribute to hepatotoxicity in the context of isoniazid treatment for tuberculosis.
title: Endoplasmic reticulum stress inhibition preserves mitochondrial function and cell survival during early onset of isoniazid-induced oxidative stress

finding: The SNP rs10129414 was part of the 24 distinct risk loci discovered in the study and was successfully replicated in a different dataset from the ENIGMA consortium, achieving a significant result (P = 6.25 × 10−30).
title: Multi-trait genome-wide analyses of the brain imaging phenotypes in UK Biobank

finding: The rs7143400-T allele was identified as contributing to an increased risk of Alzheimer's disease (AD) due to its presence within the 3'UTR of the FERMT2 gene. It was found that this allele creates a binding site for the miRNA miR-4504, which leads to down-regulation of FERMT2 expression. This down-regulation correlated with negative impacts on axonal growth, synaptic connectivity, and long-term potentiation in neurons, highlighting the role of FERMT2 in the modulation of APP metabolism and its implications in AD pathogenesis.
title: Alzheimer’s genetic risk factor FERMT2 (Kindlin-2) controls axonal growth and synaptic plasticity in an APP-dependent manner

finding: The SNP rs1802710 was linked to polar overdominance in obesity and revealed that the maternal C allele reduces expression of MEG3, further connecting its relationship with obesity risk, thereby providing insights into the mechanisms of obesity-related traits.
title: Abundant Parent-of-origin Effect eQTL in Humans: The Framingham Heart Study

finding: The rs8984 variant demonstrated an association with an increased prevalence of the long transcript isoform of the CHURC1 gene, potentially disrupting microRNA binding sites. This variant’s functional implications may relate to the altered expression of the gene.
title: The length of the expressed 3’ UTR is an intermediate molecular phenotype linking genetic variants to complex diseases

finding: The study reported that the SIX6 gene variant, specifically the homozygous risk alleles (CC) of SNP rs33912345, was associated with an increase in p16Ink4a expression. This upregulation was linked to cellular senescence, which is a critical event in the pathology of primary open-angle glaucoma (POAG). The findings indicated that this variant contributed to the molecular mechanisms underlying glaucoma, particularly through the modulation of senescence pathways in retinal ganglion cells subjected to elevated intraocular pressure.
title: Early removal of senescent cells protects retinal ganglion cells loss in experimental ocular hypertension

finding: The SNP rs2145623 coincided with a GWAS peak for several autoimmune diseases, demonstrating its regulatory potential related to transcriptional pathways involving immune responses.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: The SNP rs55883101 emerged as a central representation after merging 42 other RefSNPs. The merging process included alleles that were variants collapsing into a single reference SNP, highlighting its pivotal role in the normalization and grouping of sequence variants.
title: SPDI: Data Model for Variants and Applications at NCBI

finding: The carrier status of rs2588809 at the gene RAD51B was significantly associated with tumor mutational burden (TMB) in breast cancer, highlighting a crucial role for this SNP in influencing mutational profiles related to breast cancer.
title: Somatic mutational profiles and germline polygenic risk scores in human cancer

finding: The rs61745752 variant was associated with a higher risk of secondary malignancies such as bone metastasis, liver secondary malignant neoplasm, and an acquired absence of breast, indicative of breast cancer surgery. This finding was derived from a Phenome-Wide Association Study (PheWAS) conducted on data from the BioVU cohort containing 70 variant carriers, which showed that 11.4% had a diagnosis of malignant neoplasm of the breast, while 5.7% had diagnoses of malignant breast cancer that metastasized to bone or liver, compared to lower percentages in noncarriers. Furthermore, individuals with this variant exhibited an increased potential for metastasis, supporting the notion that rs61745752 contributes to the metastatic potential of various cancer types.
title: Coupling metastasis to pH sensing G Protein-coupled receptor-68 through first in class inhibitor identified in an in vivo chemical genetic screen

finding: This SNP was involved in the findings linked to drinking behavior, indicating associations that contribute to the genetic understanding of PAU.
title: Meta-analysis of problematic alcohol use in 435,563 individuals identifies 29 risk variants and yields insights into biology, pleiotropy and causality

finding: The SNP rs200284292 was associated with the CDCA4 gene in progenitors and mediated the expression of downstream genes CDK5 and TNPO2, indicating a significant role in regulating gene expression pathways.

finding: The SNP rs10149068 was associated with a novel locus on chromosome 14. It was identified in the African American cohort and was linked to rs8017723 with a high r^2 value (0.989).

finding: Similar to rs10149068, the SNP rs8017723 was linked at a novel locus on chromosome 14. Together with rs10149068, it contributed to the newly identified locus associated with prostate cancer.
title: Multi-ethnic transcriptome-wide association study of prostate cancer

finding: The SNP rs4900597 was linked to DNAm variation associated with the gene ZFYVE21 relevant to schizophrenia via CEWAS, indicating its role in disease risk despite being non-significant in standard gene expression analysis.
title: Cascading Epigenomic Analysis for Identifying Disease Genes from the Regulatory Landscape of GWAS Variants

finding: Though not originally pursued, rs34813623 was reported to influence schizophrenia through the mediating effect of cg08213375, which shares high linkage disequilibrium (LD = 0.84) with rs4900597, further supporting its relevance in the context of disease mechanisms.
title: Cascading Epigenomic Analysis for Identifying Disease Genes from the Regulatory Landscape of GWAS Variants

finding: The CEBPE SNP (rs2239635) was identified as potentially reducing Ikaros binding to the CEBPE promoter, thus promoting elevated CEBPE expression, which is relevant in the context of BCP-ALL pathogenesis.

finding: The SNP rs4652 in the LGALS3 gene, causing a proline to threonine substitution, was associated with rheumatoid arthritis and gastric carcinoma. finding: The SNP rs11845184 was found to be associated with neuroticism and aggression development through its involvement in the TSHR gene. title: A novel classification framework for genome-wide association study of whole brain MRI images using deep learning

finding: rs1152591 was identified as a significant eQTL for SYNE2 expression, acting as a cis-eQTL with the risk allele associated with lower SYNE2α1 mRNA expression. The SNP was located only 11 bp upstream of the SYNE2α1 transcription start site and was linked to decreased SYNE2α1 protein levels in human left atrial appendage (LAA) tissues. Additionally, rs1152591 showed a significant association with the development of atrial fibrillation (AF).
title: Atrial fibrillation associated common risk variants in SYNE2 lead to lower expression of nesprin-2α1 and increased nuclear stiffness

finding: rs1152595 was reported as a top eQTL SNP for SYNE2α1 expression, being the primary SNP associated with gene regulation. The risk alleles of this SNP also exhibited lower SYNE2α1 expression levels in the LAA tissues, similar to rs1152591. This SNP was also found to be in strong linkage disequilibrium with rs1152591 and implicated in the genetic susceptibility to atrial fibrillation.
title: Atrial fibrillation associated common risk variants in SYNE2 lead to lower expression of nesprin-2α1 and increased nuclear stiffness

finding: The SNP rs10139154 was identified as being associated with amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS) in a study involving a Chinese cohort. This finding was significant as it contributed to the understanding of the genetic basis of sporadic ALS, which was previously unclear.
title: Partitioning the genetic architecture of amyotrophic lateral sclerosis

finding: The SNP rs55883101 served as the extreme case of merging, where it received 42 merged RefSNPs based on the adaptation of the SPDI model. The previous variations, characterized by identical alleles, were collapsed into a single RefSNP. This case illustrated the efficiency of the normalization process by merging numerous records into a singular definitive representation.
title: SPDI: Data Model for Variants and Applications at NCBI

finding: The minor C allele of rs3742704 was associated with reduced GPR65 signalling, which is relevant to inflammatory bowel disease (IBD), and exhibited exacerbated inflammation in experimental colitis models. This SNP's context highlights its role in signaling pathways related to hypertension, as GPR65 inhibition affects inflammatory responses that are crucial in hypertension pathogenesis.
title: Dietary fibre controls blood pressure and cardiovascular risk by lowering large intestinal pH and activating the proton-sensing receptor GPR65

finding: The minor T allele of rs8005161 was associated with reduced GPR65 signalling, similarly relevant to inflammatory diseases, including high blood pressure (BP). Although high BP was initially associated with rs8005161, this finding was no longer significant after FDR adjustment, underscoring the complexity of genetic influences on BP and suggesting that GPR65's activation may depend on pH rather than purely genetic factors.
title: Dietary fibre controls blood pressure and cardiovascular risk by lowering large intestinal pH and activating the proton-sensing receptor GPR65

finding: The SNP rs56994090 was found to be the candidate causal variant associated with the chr14:101286447-101326447 T1D locus, colocalizing with a fetal-like iPSC-PPC-unique singleton eASQTL for the MEG3 isoform. It had a posterior probability of 100%, indicating a strong link to the regulatory mechanisms affecting T1D risk.
title: eQTL mapping in fetal-like pancreatic progenitor cells reveals early developmental insights into diabetes risk

finding: The SNP rs1042704 in the MMP14 gene was significantly associated with AIS in the initial discovery cohort, with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.239 (P=1.89E-05). However, this association was not replicated in females, suggesting sexual dimorphism in genetic susceptibility to AIS.

finding: The SNP rs10147988, located in the MEG3 gene, showed significant allelic expression differences in neurons. This finding was specifically relevant in the context of imprinting associated with human brain development.
