finding: The SNP rs12879413, found in the MEG8 gene, demonstrated distinct allelic RNA-seq counts in neurons, indicating its role in imprinted gene expression during neurogenesis.
title: Inference of cell-type specific imprinted regulatory elements and genes during human neuronal differentiation

finding: For the SNP rs1802710 in the DLK1 gene, progenitor-specific imprinting was observed, which was associated with genomic deletion regions at the Kagami Ogata syndrome paternal uniparental disomy locus.
title: Inference of cell-type specific imprinted regulatory elements and genes during human neuronal differentiation

finding: Located in the G2E3-AS1 locus, rs73243848 showed a significant association with salivary microbial composition (p = 2.35 × 10^-8), primarily positively correlating with Prevotella uSGB 2511 and members of the Bacteroidaceae family.
title: Metagenome-genome-wide association studies reveal human genetic impact on the oral microbiome

finding: The SNP rs63750082, known as the PSEN1-G206A mutation, was found to be a rare variant that is primarily associated with familial early onset Alzheimer’s disease (EOAD) in Puerto Ricans. The SNP was evaluated for imputation performance using the 1000G reference panel, where it was imputed in 12 individuals as G206A carriers. The imputation achieved a perfect prediction with 100% agreement upon subsequent genotyping confirmation, highlighting the effectiveness of the imputation method used.
title: Rare variants imputation in admixed populations: Comparison across reference panels and bioinformatics tools

finding: SNP rs9944035, which corresponds to the SYNE2 gene variant c.1721T>C (p.I574T), was associated with Emery-Dreifuss muscular dystrophy and proposed to modulate the onset of DYT1 dystonia by affecting protein interactions between TOR1A and SYNE2.
title: Association of SYNE2 variants in accelerating the progress of DYT1 early-onset isolated dystonia

finding: The SNP rs2792205 represented the SYNE2 gene variant c.12001T>C (p.W4001R), which had implications in the modulation of DYT1 dystonia progression due to its potential impact on protein-protein interaction between TOR1A and SYNE2.
title: Association of SYNE2 variants in accelerating the progress of DYT1 early-onset isolated dystonia

finding: The SNP rs2781377 was associated with the SYNE2 gene variant c.12002G>A (p.W4001Ter); this was also identified as potentially affecting the interaction with TOR1A, thus influencing the penetrance of DYT1 dystonia.
title: Association of SYNE2 variants in accelerating the progress of DYT1 early-onset isolated dystonia

finding: SNP rs175714 was shown to be associated with variations in transcription factor MAZ binding in the context of MS. It functioned in a network of influencing factors affecting MS disease status.
title: DeepWAS: Multivariate genotype-phenotype associations by directly integrating regulatory information using deep learning

finding: SNP rs7146599 was noted for its role as a mediator affecting multiple chromatin features and gene regulatory networks related to height.
title: DeepWAS: Multivariate genotype-phenotype associations by directly integrating regulatory information using deep learning

finding: In the WGS analysis of the Shetland population, rs779590262 was identified as a missense variant of uncertain significance. This variant was notable because it was discovered to be ultra-rare, being one of the 54 exonic variants out of the 79 variants that were significantly enriched in the VIKING cohort compared to controls from gnomAD. It was the only one among these which was present in ClinVar as of August 27, 2019, indicating some existing acknowledgment regarding its potential impact on gene function.
title: Increased ultra-rare variant load in an isolated Scottish population impacts exonic and regulatory regions

finding: This SNP was significant in the genome-wide analysis for volume-related imaging phenotypes, corroborated by nominal significance in the ENIGMA dataset.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide analyses of the brain imaging phenotypes in UK Biobank

finding: This SNP was part of the genome-wide significant associations found within the multi-trait analysis for imaging phenotypes, demonstrating its relevance in the investigated traits.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide analyses of the brain imaging phenotypes in UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs779590262 was identified as a missense variant of uncertain significance in the Shetland population. It was one of 54 exonic variants that were ultra-rare and significantly enriched in the VIKING cohort compared to the gnomAD dataset, suggesting a potentially impactful role on gene function.
title: Increased ultra-rare variant load in an isolated Scottish population impacts exonic and regulatory regions

finding: This SNP was also part of the 2013 GWAS, linking it to Alzheimer’s disease through significant genetic association.
title: Multi-Modal Data Analysis for Alzheimer’s Disease Diagnosis: An Ensemble Model Using Imagery and Genetic Features

finding: Identified in the 2013 GWAS, this SNP was associated with Alzheimer’s disease and showed significant links among the studied cohort.
title: Multi-Modal Data Analysis for Alzheimer’s Disease Diagnosis: An Ensemble Model Using Imagery and Genetic Features

finding: At the RAD51B locus, variant rs10483809 had significant association with T1D (P=8.1×10^-6). This T1D risk allele showed preferential binding to IRF- and CUX-family transcription factors in cytokine-induced beta cell cCREs. Electrophoretic mobility shift assays confirmed protein binding to the risk allele in MIN6 cells. The variant was associated with increased enhancer activity in response to cytokine treatment, suggesting a role in modulating beta cell survival during inflammation.
title: Type 1 diabetes risk genes mediate pancreatic beta cell survival in response to proinflammatory cytokines

finding: This SNP, located in the <italic>STON2</italic> gene, was identified as a known schizophrenia variant in humans, indicating its potential relevance to the pathology of this neurodevelopmental disorder.
title: Evolutionary constraint genes implicated in autism spectrum disorder across 2,054 nonhuman primate genomes

finding: The rs8010699 SNP resulted in an H3309R substitution in nesprin-2. This variant was associated with the expression of the tumor suppressor cyclin-dependent kinase inhibitor 1 (CDK1/p21) in HBV-related hepatocellular carcinomas, correlating with its role in muscular dystrophy.
title: Peptide Ancestry Informative Markers in Uterine Neoplasms from Women of European, African and Asian Ancestry

finding: The variant rs2239630 was located in the core promoter region of the gene CEBPE and was reported as having a posterior probability of 1, indicating a strong association with acute lymphoblastic leukemia (ALL). This variant showed dynamic regulatory activity particularly at the pre-B cell stage of B-cell development, which was highlighted as a critical point in the differentiation trajectory relevant to predisposition to ALL.
title: Variant to function mapping at single-cell resolution through network propagation

finding: The rs3825761 SNP was highlighted as a fine-mapped variant that colocalized with the NUDT14 eQTL and reticulocyte count GWAS signal. It was associated with the introduction of a premature stop codon resulting in a transcript with a long 3' UTR inducing NMD. The colocalization patterns indicated that the NUDT14 sQTL impacts expression levels and is relevant for the phenotypic traits captured in the GWAS.
title: Cryptic splicing mediates genetic and therapeutic perturbation of human gene expression levels

finding: The SNP rs2841277 was found to be associated with susceptibility to rheumatoid arthritis. This suggests a potential genetic marker for identifying individuals at higher risk for developing this autoimmune disease.
title: Structural and mechanistic insights into disease-associated endolysosomal exonucleases PLD3 and PLD4

finding: The SNP rs75255901 was identified as a putative causal variant linked to DAAM1, which affects the precuneus, a brain region suggested to have undergone recent evolutionary changes in the Homo sapiens lineage. This variant was highlighted in a large genome-wide association analysis of brain magnetic resonance imaging data involving 51,665 individuals, emphasizing its relevance to variations in brain structure.
title: Fine-grained temporal mapping of derived high-frequency variants supports the mosaic nature of the evolution of Homo sapiens

finding: The rs116909374 SNP was identified as a risk allele for thyroid cancer, with its association determined through genome-wide association studies (GWAS). This SNP resides in the NKX2-1 super-enhancer region, which plays a crucial role in oncogenic regulation in various conditions including lung adenocarcinoma (LUAD) and thyroid cancer.
title: Dosage amplification dictates oncogenic regulation by the NKX2-1 lineage factor in lung adenocarcinoma

finding: The rs10132289 SNP was associated with lung function, specifically the FEV1/FVC ratio. This SNP was also located within the NKX2-1 super-enhancer region and became relevant in the context of lung development and diseases related to NKX2-1.
title: Dosage amplification dictates oncogenic regulation by the NKX2-1 lineage factor in lung adenocarcinoma

finding: The SNP rs4905194 was trans-associated with the gene CPEB2 in the liver, forming a gene network that contained 48 causal interactions at a 10% FDR threshold. This finding indicated that CPEB2 was a critical regulator within this network.
title: Gene networks driven by genetic variation for plasma cortisol in hepatic and adipose tissues implicate corticosteroid binding globulin in modulating tissue glucocorticoid action and cardiovascular risk

finding: The SNP rs11622665 was found to be trans-associated with RNF13 in subcutaneous fat, leading to the construction of a major gene sub-network consisting of 215 gene targets at a 10% FDR threshold.
title: Gene networks driven by genetic variation for plasma cortisol in hepatic and adipose tissues implicate corticosteroid binding globulin in modulating tissue glucocorticoid action and cardiovascular risk

finding: The SNP rs8022616 was associated with the transcription factor IRF2 in subcutaneous fat, facilitating regulation of a gene network that included 128 genes at a 10% FDR threshold.
title: Gene networks driven by genetic variation for plasma cortisol in hepatic and adipose tissues implicate corticosteroid binding globulin in modulating tissue glucocorticoid action and cardiovascular risk

finding: The SNP rs2005945 was identified with trans-associations for the genes CD163 and LUC7L3 in visceral abdominal fat.
title: Gene networks driven by genetic variation for plasma cortisol in hepatic and adipose tissues implicate corticosteroid binding globulin in modulating tissue glucocorticoid action and cardiovascular risk

finding: SNP rs11626366 was associated with inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) and was identified as a risk SNP located 46kb from the gene SLC24A4. The sub-network analysis revealed that this SNP is part of a complex regulatory landscape influencing multiple genes across various cell types, particularly within classical monocytes, highlighting the role of transcription factors (TFs) in regulating disease-associated gene networks.
title: Continuous lifelong learning for modeling of gene regulation from single cell multiome data by leveraging atlas-scale external data

finding: The positive finding related to SNP rs8020119 was its application to efficiently emulate radiative transfer codes for land surface parameter inferences. This contributed significantly to our understanding of land surface interactions and ecosystem monitoring.
title: Scientific opportunities for developing essential biodiversity variables from satellite remote sensing in the context of the post-2020 global biodiversity framework

finding: The presence of XRCC3 rs1799794 was associated with an increased risk of neutropenia in CRC patients, indicating its relevance in treatment-related side effects.
title: Pharmacogenomics, biomarker network and allele frequencies in colorectal cancer

finding: The minor T-allele in rs4899412 was associated with lower heart rate variability (HRV) and higher expression of RGS6. This aligns with previous findings in humans showing that loss-of-function variants in RGS6 tended to result in increased HRV. In zebrafish, heterozygous mutations in rgs6 led to a heart rate reduction at 2 days post-fertilization (dpf), mirroring mouse studies, although this effect was not observed at 5 dpf.
title: Translating GWAS-identified loci for cardiac rhythm and rate using an in vivo image- and CRISPR/Cas9-based approach

finding: This SNP was linked to atrial fibrillation and was proposed to affect expression of SYNE2, suggesting a significant role in cardiac muscle function.
title: Fine mapping spatiotemporal mechanisms of genetic variants underlying cardiac traits and disease

finding: The finding indicated that rs56994090 (chr14:101306447:T>C) was identified as the most likely causal variant affecting the MEG3 isoform, suggesting a mechanism by which the T1D-risk locus influences disease risk.
title: Disease-associated regulatory variation often displays plasticity or temporal-specificity in fetal pancreas

finding: The study identified that the rs1957757 polymorphism in the HIF-1alpha gene interacted with CpG island methylation in the promoter region, which was associated with an increased risk of anti-tuberculosis drug-induced liver injury. This finding was based on a case-control study, indicating the relevance of this SNP in the context of INH-mediated hepatotoxicity.
title: Endoplasmic reticulum stress inhibition preserves mitochondrial function and cell survival during early onset of isoniazid-induced oxidative stress

finding: The study indicated that the PSMA6 variant, specifically rs1048990, was associated with an increased risk of coronary artery disease. This finding was grounded in the understanding that proteasome activity, which is affected by genetic variation, plays a significant role in protein degradation and cellular functions that could impact phenotypes such as cardiovascular health.
title: Substrate-Specific Effects of Natural Genetic Variation on Proteasome Activity

finding: The rs999737 SNP from the RAD51B gene was demonstrated to be statistically significant for breast cancer susceptibility, reinforcing earlier findings.
title: DOT: Gene-set analysis by combining decorrelated association statistics

finding: Identified in the context of new breast cancer associations, rs7359088 from the RAD51B gene region demonstrated significant relationships.
title: DOT: Gene-set analysis by combining decorrelated association statistics

finding: For SNP rs11158026, the gene <italic>GCH1</italic> was mentioned as being the most proximal and showing significant enrichment and specificity in dopaminergic neurons, highlighting its importance in Parkinson's research.
title: Single cell spatial transcriptomic and translatomic profiling of dopaminergic neurons in health, aging and disease

finding: The SNP rs8018720 was identified as one of the significant markers associated with 25OHD concentration.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies 143 loci associated with 25 hydroxyvitamin D concentration

finding: The polymorphism AKAP6-rs17522122*T was associated with worse baseline performance in episodic memory, working memory, vocabulary, and perceptual speed. This finding indicated its potential role in cognitive function and suggested that it may serve as an early biomarker for Alzheimer's disease (AD), particularly in the transition from mild cognitive impairment (MCI) to AD.
title: An Alzheimer’s disease patient-derived olfactory cell model identifies gene expression changes associated with cognition

finding: Moderate selection was noted at rs12896399 associated with the SLC24A4 gene, with an estimated selection coefficient (s) of around 0.005. Previous analyses suggested that this SNP underwent positive selection in Out-of-Africa populations. The timing of selection was estimated to have begun around 30,000 years ago.
title: An approximate full-likelihood method for inferring selection and allele frequency trajectories from DNA sequence data

finding: The SNP rs1800839 was predicted to decrease CREB1 binding affinity to the promoter and enhancer regions of PSEN1, thereby elucidating a potential mechanism for PSEN1 upregulation in Alzheimer's Disease (AD). This finding highlights CREB1's regulatory role in neurodegenerative processes.
title: RNetDys: identification of disease-related impaired regulatory interactions due to SNPs

finding: The SNP rs176324 was consistently identified at both planting locations (Roujol and Godet) with significant associations for oxidative browning (OB), explaining 10.16% and 10.76% of the variance respectively. Genotypes with the homozygous GG locus did not display OB, while the presence of allele 'T' was linked to increased OB expression. This SNP was located in the intronic region of Dioal.02G052400, which encodes acireductone dioxygenase.
title: Genome-wide association studies reveal novel loci controlling tuber flesh color and oxidative browning in Dioscorea alata

finding: SNP rs10431750 was implicated in the regulation of APOPT1 junction Exon_1.4 and other junctions, suggesting a complex relationship with alternative splicing associated with schizophrenia risk.
title: Variations and expression features of CYP2D6 contribute to schizophrenia risk

finding: The SNP rs1042704 was identified as a strong association with Dupuytren's Disease (DD). The variant, which causes a non-synonymous mutation in the MMP14 gene, was characterized as likely causative. It encoded the enzyme Membrane-Type 1 Matrix Metalloproteinase (MT1-MMP) with an amino acid substitution from Asp<sub>273</sub> to Asn<sub>273</sub> (D<sub>273</sub> to N<sub>273</sub>). Functionally, the MT1-N<sub>273</sub> variant exhibited only 17% collagenolytic activity compared to the ancestral enzyme MT1-D<sub>273</sub>. This reduced activity was notably persistent in patient-derived DD myofibroblasts, regardless of their genotypes (heterozygous G/A or homozygous A/A). Furthermore, the collation of findings indicated that the alternate A allele significantly correlated with a higher likelihood of developing DD, increasing the odds by 1.25. The allele frequency of the A allele was found to be approximately 0.20 in Western European populations, suggesting a substantial impact on the fibrotic phenotype associated with the disease.
title: An SNP variant MT1-MMP with a defect in its collagenolytic activity confers the fibrotic phenotype of Dupuytren’s Disease

finding: This variant was causally associated with lower risk of type 2 diabetes and diabetic kidney disease, linked to the ENTPD5 protein levels.
title: Whole genome sequencing analysis of the cardiometabolic proteome

finding: Analyzed in the study, this variant was found to be associated with lower risk of both type 2 diabetes and diabetic kidney disease, linked to the ENTPD5 protein.
title: Whole genome sequencing analysis of the cardiometabolic proteome

finding: The SNP rs6573723 was characterized as an intronic variant of GPHN, with nominal significance (P = 0.028) observed in liver expression between high-fat and low-fat fed mice, tying it to lipid levels.
title: Genetically regulated gene expression underlies lipid traits in Hispanic cohorts

finding: The rs12881760 C allele, found at high frequency in European populations and rare in Africans, was associated with the expression of a cluster of 12 miRNAs and showed extreme population differentiation, indicating its role in genetic control of miRNA diversity and suggesting positive selection in Europe.
title: Population variation of miRNAs and isomiRs and their impact on human immunity to infection

finding: Associated with increased expression of PCNX1 in both fetal and adult cortices, rs221902's regulatory effects could relate to neurodevelopmental functions.
title: Autism spectrum disorder: understanding the impact of SNPs on biological pathways in the fetal and adult cortex

finding: The SNP rs192581407 was reported as a top QTL associated with orotidine, with a significance level of p < 1e-17, highlighting its potential influence on this metabolite.
title: yQTL Pipeline: a structured computational workflow for large scale quantitative trait loci discovery and downstream visualization

finding: The SNP rs2230500 acted as an eQTL for HIF1A in IGHMlo memory B cells and was involved in rheumatoid arthritis as revealed in both trans-ancestry and East Asian GWAS, linking it to inflammatory processes.
title: Single-cell analysis of human diversity in circulating immune cells

finding: The SNP rs7160525 in the SGPP1 gene exhibited association with ceramide traits (P=5.67×10^-10), influencing the recycling of CER[NS] species. It was also linked to blood cell phenotypes.
title: Heritability and family-based GWAS analyses of the N-acyl ethanolamine and ceramide plasma lipidome

finding: The rs7143400 T allele was found to be associated with increased Alzheimer's disease (AD) risk. It led to a downregulation of FERMT2 through the action of miR-4504 which was overexpressed in brains of AD patients. The presence of the T allele created a binding site for miR-4504, impacting APP metabolism and increasing Aβ secretion, thus providing mechanistic insight into the role of genetic variants in AD pathogenesis.
title: Alzheimer’s genetic risk factor FERMT2 (Kindlin-2) is regulated by risk allele-binding of miR-4504 and leads to synaptic dysfunction in an APP-dependent manner

finding: The association of rs2887399 with slower clonal expansion was established, where individuals carrying two copies of the protective allele had up to 80% reduced odds of possessing driver mutations in genes such as TET2, ASXL1, SF3B1, SRSF2, and JAK2. This variant was associated with a significant decrease in passenger counts, indicating its potential role as a protective factor in clonal hematopoiesis, particularly mediated through the regulation of TCL1A expression.
title: Clonal hematopoiesis is driven by aberrant activation of TCL1A

finding: SNP rs365990 was associated with two traits in opposite directions, highlighting its multifaceted role in blood pressure regulation.
title: Multivariate Genomewide Association Analysis with IHT

finding: At the DLK1/MEG3 locus, rs3783355 was prioritized as a secondary signal with a high posterior probability of association, indicating its context-dependent regulatory role in modulating T1D risk in pancreatic islet endocrine cells.
title: Single-cell gene expression and chromatin accessibility profiling of human pancreatic islets at basal and stimulatory conditions nominates mechanisms of type 1 diabetes genetic risk

finding: The SNP rs1887944, located on 14q31.2, was nominally associated with chronotype (P <= 9.5e-6). This association suggests a potential evolutionary benefit of variation in sleep patterns due to its proposed protective effects against predators.
title: Diverse functions associate with trans-species polymorphisms in humans

finding: The SNP rs7147645 was also nominally associated with chronotype (P <= 9.5e-6), similar to rs1887944, indicating a genetic influence on sleep timing and its adaptive significance in human populations.
title: Diverse functions associate with trans-species polymorphisms in humans

finding: The SNP rs8020022 was associated with the regulation of Sonic Hedgehog signaling pathways. This finding contributed to the understanding of glioblastoma therapy resistance, particularly how inhibition of this pathway by cyclopamine sensitized glioblastoma cell lines to temozolomide. The relationship was highlighted by the discovery that cyclopamine treatment reduced glioblastoma cell viability and induced apoptosis.
title: Cyclopamine sensitizes Glioblastoma cells to Temozolomide treatment through Sonic Hedgehog pathway

finding: The SNP rs10151259 was associated with Leber congenital amaurosis and was noted for differing frequencies in the Ukrainian population compared to others.
title: Genome Diversity in Ukraine

finding: The rs781779034 SNP was modeled in yeast and exhibited a null-like phenotype for mismatch repair (MMR) and crossing over. This finding indicated deleterious effects on reproductive processes, suggesting that variants at this locus could contribute to reproductive abnormalities in human populations.
title: MLH1/3 variants causing aneuploidy, pregnancy loss, and premature reproductive aging

finding: The rs138006166 SNP was associated with null-like MMR and crossing over defects in the yeast models. This supported conclusions that variants in this region may predispose individuals to reproductive challenges such as pregnancy loss.
title: MLH1/3 variants causing aneuploidy, pregnancy loss, and premature reproductive aging

finding: Similar to the other SNPs, rs781739661 exhibited null-like effects for MMR and meiotic crossing over when tested in yeast. These defects underscore the potential reproductive implications associated with variations at this locus.
title: MLH1/3 variants causing aneuploidy, pregnancy loss, and premature reproductive aging

finding: The rs7143400 variant, located in the 3'UTR of the FERMT2 gene, was shown to modulate miR-4504 binding, leading to decreased FERMT2 expression. This decreased expression was linked to increased Aβ secretion and impaired synaptic plasticity, thereby contributing to Alzheimer's disease (AD) mechanisms. The T allele of rs7143400 created an 8-mer binding site for miR-4504, which was over-expressed in AD brains and influenced the regulation of FERMT2 and APP metabolism in individuals carrying the T allele.
title: Alzheimer’s genetic risk factor FERMT2 (Kindlin-2) is regulated by risk allele-binding of miR-4504 and leads to synaptic dysfunction in an APP-dependent manner

finding: The variant was characterized as a cryptic splice-donor site in <italic>CCDC88C</italic>. It was predicted to affect protein-coding sequences, contributing to breast cancer susceptibility.
title: Fine-mapping of 150 breast cancer risk regions identifies 178 high confidence target genes

finding: The AKT1 rs1130233 SNP was found to significantly modulate the acute effects of THC on brain activation during fear processing. Specifically, a higher number of A alleles was associated with increased activation in brain regions such as the parahippocampal and cingulate gyri when subjects processed fearful faces. The presence of the A allele was linked to lower expression of AKT1 and corresponded with heightened anxiety and psychotomimetic effects after THC administration.
title: Epigenetic mediation of AKT1 rs1130233’s effect on delta-9-tetrahydrocannabinol-induced medial temporal function during fear processing

finding: At the DLK1/MEG3 locus, rs56994090 was identified as the lead variant for the primary signal, although it did not overlap any features used in the model but was prioritized as potentially causal for T1D genetic risk.
title: Single-cell gene expression and chromatin accessibility profiling of human pancreatic islets at basal and stimulatory conditions nominates mechanisms of type 1 diabetes genetic risk

finding: At the DLK1/MEG3 locus, rs3783355 was identified as a strong candidate through its secondary signal with a 7-fold higher posterior probability of association compared to other variants. It was linked to increased co-accessibility with DLK1 and MEG3 promoter regions, particularly in cytokine-stimulated beta cells.
title: Single-cell gene expression and chromatin accessibility profiling of human pancreatic islets at basal and stimulatory conditions nominates mechanisms of type 1 diabetes genetic risk

finding: The rs7143400-T allele was identified as being associated with an increased risk of Alzheimer's disease (AD). It created a binding site for miR-4504 within the 3'UTR of the FERMT2 gene, leading to down-regulation of FERMT2 expression. The research provided strong evidence that this under-expression of FERMT2 led to detrimental impacts on axon growth, synaptic connectivity, and long-term potentiation, which are processes that modulate APP metabolism.
title: Alzheimer’s genetic risk factor FERMT2 (Kindlin-2) controls axonal growth and synaptic plasticity in an APP-dependent manner

finding: At rs12896399 in the SLC24A4 gene, moderate evidence for selection was found (s ~ 0.005). This SNP is associated with hair color and suggests selection was acting as early as ~30,000 years ago.
title: An approximate full-likelihood method for inferring selection and allele frequency trajectories from DNA sequence data

finding: The SNP rs7148456 in the BAG5 locus was edited using a dCas9-based ABEmax vector, achieving editing efficiencies of 11.2% for high PRS and 13.8% for low PRS hiPSCs. This result confirmed the capability of base editing to modify this specific SNP that is associated with allele-specific open chromatin, further elucidating its role in schizophrenia risk.
title: Publicly available hiPSC lines with extreme polygenic risk scores for modeling schizophrenia

finding: For the PCK2 locus, rs7146599 was confirmed as a contact eQTL that disrupted a CTCF binding motif, leading to implications for enhancer insulation and increased PCK2 expression in monocytes.
title: Shared and distinct molecular effects of regulatory genetic variants provide insight into mechanisms of distal enhancer-promoter communication

finding: The variant rs2400899 was connected to the gene Slc25a47 and linked to Leydig cell-specific regulatory activity, showing a significant association with testosterone levels (p=4.993e-10). This SNP was thought to influence mitochondrial functions in Leydig cell steroidogenesis.
title: The single-cell epigenetic regulatory landscape in mammalian perinatal testis development

finding: The SNP rs941576 was linked to T1D susceptibility and rheumatoid arthritis, situated within a conserved regulatory region of the maternally expressed gene Meg3. Its association with non-coding variants suggested a potential role in the regulation of the nearby gene Dlk1.
title: The single-cell epigenetic regulatory landscape in mammalian perinatal testis development

finding: The rs61745752 variant encoded an E336X truncated GPR68 receptor that exhibited gain-of-function properties. This variant was associated with several malignancies, including malignant melanoma with an odds ratio of 5.6, malignant neoplasm of prostate (OR 1.75), and secondary malignant neoplasms of the liver and bone (OR 3.3). In the BioVU cohort, it correlated with breast cancer-related phenotypes and metastasis, indicating a significant role in cancer progression.
title: Coupling Metastasis to pH-Sensing GPR68 Using a Novel Small Molecule Inhibitor

finding: SNP rs1351618 was shown to have a moderate probability of causality (0.390) for post-FVC, located in an intron of EGLN3. Similar to rs10857225, it was found to be more prevalent in African ancestry populations, indicating potentially relevant genetic associations for lung function.
title: Integrative genomic analysis in African American children with asthma finds 3 novel loci associated with lung function

finding: Identified as a novel cis-pQTL for MARK3, associated with increased plasma levels of myeloid white cells and indicative of the immune response related to COVID-19 pathology.
title: Genetic architecture of host proteins interacting with SARS-CoV-2

finding: rs73586669 was associated with mean activity levels during sleep with a p-value of 2.4×10^-8. It was located near the gene OR4E1, again revealing a novel connection as it had not been previously associated with sleep activity.
title: Automated Feature Extraction from Population Wearable Device Data Identified Novel Loci Associated with Sleep and Circadian Rhythms

finding: The study found that the allele associated with SNP rs1065059 was linked to the IGHV1-2*04 allele. It was reported that individuals possessing the T allele at this SNP had reduced usage of the IGHV1-2*04 allele compared to those with A alleles. Specifically, it indicated the allele's effect on VRC01-class B cell precursor frequencies in heterozygotes.
title: Vaccine genetics of IGHV1-2 VRC01-class broadly neutralizing antibody precursor naïve human B cells

finding: The variant at SNP rs112806369 was found to distinguish between the IGHV1-2*04 and IGHV1-2*02/06 alleles. It was shown that individuals with the T/T genotype exhibited the lowest IGHV1-2 usage and were significantly less likely to utilize the IGHV1-2*02 allele, which supports its importance in generating favorable VRC01-class B cell responses.
title: Vaccine genetics of IGHV1-2 VRC01-class broadly neutralizing antibody precursor naïve human B cells

finding: This SNP overlapped with CAMBUS+ OCRs of plasmablast, indicating its connection to hemoglobin A1c levels. It was identified as an intronic variant of MIDEAS, which was associated with mean corpuscular hemoglobin concentration.
title: Predicted constrained accessible regions mark regulatory elements and causal variants

finding: The variant rs1056879 exhibited a negative effect size as an eQTL associated with the gene PPP2R3C in oligodendrocytes, D1/D2 medium spiny neurons (MSNs), and FS interneurons. The study showed that expression of PPP2R3C was lower in individuals with alcohol use disorder (AUD), suggesting that this gene could play a protective role against AUD.
title: Integrated Single-Cell Multiomic Profiling of Caudate Nucleus Suggests Key Mechanisms in Alcohol Use Disorder

finding: At the 14q32 locus, rs56330734 demonstrated heterogeneity in effects on beta cell subtype chromatin, with the T2D risk allele showing increased accessibility in beta-2 relative to beta-1 cells. This allele was predicted to create an NKX2-2 motif, suggesting its role in promoting beta-2 subtype identity and impacting T2D risk.
title: Integration of single-cell multiomic measurements across disease states with genetics identifies mechanisms of beta cell dysfunction in type 2 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs8005092 emerged as a significant finding from the males-only GWAS for systemizing, with a p-value of 3.74×10−8, highlighting its potential relevance to male autistic traits.
title: Social and non-social autism symptom and trait domains are genetically dissociable

finding: The SNP rs8020113 was associated with a critical aspect of coral reef ecology, specifically in the study conducted by Ferrari et al. (2016) which focused on quantifying habitat structural complexity through underwater 3D modeling. This finding underscored the importance of structural complexity in supporting diverse benthic communities, relevant to both shallow and mesophotic zones of coral reefs.
title: Hidden in the deep: distinct benthic trajectories call for monitoring of mesophotic reefs

finding: It represented average MAF distribution among the total analyzed, aligning with estimates of genetic diversity.
title: The forensic landscape and the population genetic analyses of Hainan Li based on massively parallel sequencing DNA profiling

finding: The SNP rs1535464, located in the intronic region of SLC25A47, was significantly associated with lower levels of fasting and random glucose, lower HbA1c levels adjusted for BMI, and higher HDL cholesterol levels. This finding highlighted the role of SLC25A47 in glycemic and lipid homeostasis.
title: A liver-specific mitochondrial carrier that controls gluconeogenesis and energy expenditure

finding: The SNP rs35097172, found in the regulatory region of SLC25A47, showed significant associations with lower levels of fasting and random glucose, lower HbA1c levels adjusted for BMI, and higher HDL cholesterol levels. This association further confirmed the involvement of SLC25A47 in regulating glucose and lipid homeostasis.
title: A liver-specific mitochondrial carrier that controls gluconeogenesis and energy expenditure

finding: The SNP rs1988588, part of a Type 1 Diabetes-associated locus, showed the largest and most significant effect on expression when examined in conjunction with rs3902659, suggesting a synergistic interaction between these two adjacent SNPs that reduce transcription.
title: Resolving mechanisms of immune-mediated disease in primary CD4 T cells

finding: Similar to rs1988588, rs3902659 demonstrated substantial expression-modulating effects in combination with rs1988588 in the Type 1 Diabetes locus, with both SNPs exerting weaker effects when tested individually.
title: Resolving mechanisms of immune-mediated disease in primary CD4 T cells

finding: The SNP rs17125944 was also part of the 2013 GWAS involving 74,046 individuals of European ancestry, establishing its association with Alzheimer's disease.
title: Multi-Modal Data Analysis for Alzheimer’s Disease Diagnosis: An Ensemble Model Using Imagery and Genetic Features

finding: Identified in the same 2013 GWAS, rs10498633 was shown to have a significant association with Alzheimer's disease.
title: Multi-Modal Data Analysis for Alzheimer’s Disease Diagnosis: An Ensemble Model Using Imagery and Genetic Features

finding: The SNP rs150526114 was reported as part of a haplotype at the immunoglobulin heavy chain locus, showing extreme frequency differentiation in Southeast Asian populations, where it was observed at 91% frequency in CDX, 73% in KHV, and 59% in CHS. This allele closely matched sequences found in Neanderthal genomes, indicating a Neanderthal-introgressed origin and was linked to a strong episode of positive selection occurring between 1700 and 8400 years ago.
title: Local adaptation and archaic introgression shape global diversity at human structural variant loci

finding: This SNP in the 5' region of BMP4 demonstrated a significant result (p=0.043) but was in complete linkage disequilibrium with two other non-significant SNPs, leading to a decision not to pursue further investigation.
title: Mutations in the Bone Morphogenetic Protein signaling pathway sensitize zebrafish and humans to ethanol-induced jaw malformations

finding: The minor T-allele in rs4899412 was associated with lower heart rate variability (HRV) and higher expression of RGS6 in esophagus and tibial nerve tissues. This relationship was consistent with human data, where loss-of-function variants in RGS6 correlated with higher HRV. Although the study found that zebrafish embryos with CRISPR mutations in rgs6 had a lower heart rate at 2 days post-fertilization (dpf), no significant effect on HRV was observed, potentially due to low mutant allele frequency.
title: Translating GWAS-identified loci for cardiac rhythm and rate using an in vivo image- and CRISPR-Cas9-based approach

finding: This newly identified SNP was associated with circulating vitamin D levels and further instrumental in the analysis of vitamin D's effects on health outcomes.
title: An atlas on causal role of circulating vitamin D concentrations in human complex traits and diseases

finding: The rs225014 polymorphism in the DIO2 gene, which leads to the Thr92Ala substitution in the DIO2 enzyme, was positively associated with osteoarthritis in a genome-wide linkage study. This finding was replicated in a separate cohort, highlighting the relevance of DIO2 in osteoarthritis pathogenesis and its implications for local thyroid hormone regulation.
title: Accelerating functional gene discovery in osteoarthritis

finding: The SNP rs8018155 was identified as a breast cancer risk variant and an eQTL. It was found to significantly influence the expression of the gene CCDC88C, suggesting its crucial role in modulating gene expression in relation to breast cancer.
title: xQTLbiolinks: a comprehensive and scalable tool for integrative analysis of molecular QTLs

finding: The SNP rs73301485 was associated with decreased levels of ENTPD5 and was linked to lower risks of type 2 diabetes and diabetic kidney disease, showing strong significance (p=2.61x10^-19).
title: Whole genome sequencing analysis of the cardiometabolic proteome

finding: The SNP rs140111715 was identified as another variant linked to decreased ENTPD5 levels, further supporting the association with lower type 2 diabetes risk, highlighted by a very low p-value of 2.29x10^-43.
title: Whole genome sequencing analysis of the cardiometabolic proteome

finding: The SNP rs119476050 was located at the interface of the ATL1-ATL1 complex, which is implicated in autosomal dominant hereditary spastic paraplegia. The mutation was found to disrupt the protein-protein interaction as classified by SWING, which correctly identified its pathogenic potential, contrary to AlphaMissense which predicted it as benign. This variant was clinically classified as 'likely pathogenic' due to its impact on ATL1's function in membrane fusion.
title: Sliding Window INteraction Grammar (SWING): a generalized interaction language model for peptide and protein interactions

finding: Associated with upregulation of 10 TE families, rs72691418 was also identified to influence the L1 family gene expression positively, showcasing its significant regulatory capability.
title: An eQTL-based Approach Reveals Candidate L1 Transcriptional Regulators in Lymphoblastoid Cells

finding: This SNP was discovered to have a significant association with platelet count, showing maternal effects (p-value = 1.2×10^-18) and stronger associations than previously noted SNPs in the same locus.
title: Parent-of-origin effects in the UK Biobank

finding: This SNP was associated with platelet crit, replicating a previously described link, with a maternal p-value of 7×10^-17.
title: Parent-of-origin effects in the UK Biobank

finding: This SNP was shown to associate with decreased platelet count when the A allele is maternally inherited, corroborating earlier findings.
title: Parent-of-origin effects in the UK Biobank

finding: Colocalization was reported between the eQTL for miR-4707-3p and multiple brain phenotypes including educational attainment and head size. The A allele at rs4981455 correlated with increased miR-4707-3p expression, indicating a potential mechanism where increased miR-4707-3p may influence neurogenic divisions affecting brain size and cognitive aspects.
title: MicroRNA-eQTLs in the developing human neocortex link miR-4707-3p expression to brain size

finding: The study identified a correlation of the seed sequence variant rs2273626 with differential expression of miR-4707-3p. The presence of the A allele at this locus indicated lower expression of miR-4707-3p in heterozygous samples, further illuminating the impact of this SNP on the expression of the miRNA.
title: MicroRNA-eQTLs in the developing human neocortex link miR-4707-3p expression to brain size

finding: This SNP precisely coincided with a GWAS peak for autoimmune diseases such as ulcerative colitis and Crohn's disease, supporting its role as a functional rSNP in immune responses.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: The rs2887399 T allele increased the risk of acquiring a DNMT3A CHIP mutation by 1.23-fold (p=3.9x10<sup>-9</sup>) while simultaneously decreasing the likelihood of acquiring a TET2 CHIP mutation (OR 0.82, p=0.0012).
title: Inherited Causes of Clonal Hematopoiesis of Indeterminate Potential in TOPMed Whole Genomes

finding: The SNP rs151154986 affected ACOT2 in Patient 3, which plays a role in generating free fatty acids, displaying an allele frequency of 0.0218. Its implications in skeletal muscle metabolism were noted.
title: Rare disease research workflow using multilayer networks elucidates the molecular determinants of severity in Congenital Myasthenic Syndromes

finding: The missense variant rs2273607 (p.Val104Met) in DLK1 showed a frequency 177 times greater in FinMetSeq compared to NFE and was connected with a mean decrease in height of 1.3 cm, affecting growth-related traits.
title: Exome sequencing identifies high-impact trait-associated alleles enriched in Finns

finding: The LGALS-3 (rs4652) gene variant was implicated in increased coronary artery disease risk specifically in diabetic individuals, marking it as a potential biomarker for CAD.
title: Identification of novel prognostic targets in coronary artery disease and related complications using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: SNP rs176324 was associated with cooking time, with genotypes carrying the GA allele being linked to longer cooking times relative to GG genotypes, which had shorter cooking times.
title: Detecting the genetic variants associated with key culinary traits in Dioscorea alata

finding: The association of SERPINA4 (rs2093266) variants with acute kidney injury post-COVID-19 indicated its potential role in renal complications during viral infections.
title: Identification of novel prognostic targets in acute kidney injury using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SERPINA5 (rs1955656) genetic variant was linked to acute kidney injury in patients with COVID-19, underscoring its importance in renal health in acute medical settings.
title: Identification of novel prognostic targets in acute kidney injury using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The study found rs1263872 polymorphism in the Ribonuclease 7 gene was associated with reduced antimicrobial activity and was linked to an increased risk of pediatric urinary tract infections. This finding highlighted the importance of genetic variation in immune response, as variations at this locus could influence susceptibility to infections.
title: A suite of selective pressures supports the maintenance of alleles of a Drosophila immune peptide

finding: The SNP rs10498633 was identified as a top Alzheimer's disease (AD)-associated SNP in the IGAP AD meta-analysis study. It was predicted to affect the transcription factor TCF12, which plays significant roles in neurogenesis and developmental processes. This finding was contextualized within the analysis of regulatory networks impacted by herpesvirus, highlighting TCF12's involvement in AD pathology.
title: MethReg: estimating the regulatory potential of DNA methylation in gene transcription

finding: The SNP rs73313052 was strongly associated with the surface area of the primary visual cortex and adjacent regions, specifically linked with the gene DAAM1, which plays a crucial role in neuronal migration and development of the visual cortex. The finding indicated that major-allele homozygotes (GG) showed a significant positive correlation between the volume of the lateral geniculate nucleus and the surface area of the visual cortex. In contrast, this correlation was absent in carriers of the minor allele (GA or AA), emphasizing the functional implications of this SNP in visual cortex development.
title: Planar cell polarity pathway and development of the human visual cortex

finding: The A allele of rs1950834 was associated with decreased accessibility of a caPeak in progenitors and was linked to decreased expression of lncRNA AL121821.1. This SNP disrupted ETV1 binding and showed protective effects against MDD.
title: Cell-type specific effects of genetic variation on chromatin accessibility during human neuronal differentiation

finding: The rs3742330 A>C SNP was associated with increased susceptibility and malignancy in gastric cancer, enhanced survival rates in T-cell lymphoma patients, and reduced aggressiveness in prostate cancer.
title: A pan-cancer atlas of somatic mutations in miRNA biogenesis genes

finding: The rs1057035 SNP in DICER1 was associated with survival outcomes in breast cancer patients.
title: A pan-cancer atlas of somatic mutations in miRNA biogenesis genes

finding: The missense mutation in MRPP3 (rs11156878) was associated with methylation levels across multiple tissue types, showing its involvement in the processing of mitochondrial tRNAs. This variant connects directly to mitochondrial functions and implications for disease.
title: Nuclear genetic regulation of human mitochondrial RNA modification

finding: The SNP rs12365 pertained to the gene dns (vpbb_rs12365), which was involved in the construction of the BB22OP strain. This strain was genetically modified by replacing the dns gene with a tetracycline resistance gene (TetR). This finding highlighted the importance of the dns gene in bacterial resistance and the role of genetic modifications in studying bacterial immunity and antibiotic resistance.
title: Gamma-Mobile-Trio systems define a new class of mobile elements rich in bacterial defensive and offensive tools

finding: SNP rs12896399 was mentioned as one of the additional loci that, when homozygous for the minor allele, increased the tint of blue eyes in individuals, contributing to the phenotype.
title: A general model for two-locus assortative mating analysis and prediction

finding: The SNP rs8023164 was found to alter the binding affinity of the transcription factor FOSL2, which is relevant to multiple sclerosis (MS) and systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE). This change in binding was associated with alterations in regulatory mechanisms impacting Th17 responses.
title: The AP-1 factors FOSL1 and FOSL2 co-regulate human Th17 responses

finding: The SNP rs17103360 was identified to affect FOSL2's binding to DNA, linking it to both multiple sclerosis (MS) and rheumatoid arthritis (RA). This alteration was significant in the context of Th17 cell differentiation and function.
title: The AP-1 factors FOSL1 and FOSL2 co-regulate human Th17 responses

finding: SNP rs12590654, associated with the gene SLC24A4, exhibited the highest significance level (p=0.001) among the tested SNPs in the study related to PART. It highlighted the genetic overlap with Alzheimer disease.
title: Genome-wide association study and functional validation implicates JADE1 in tauopathy

finding: The study identified that the germline risk allele rs861539, located in the conserved RAD51 domain of XRCC3, was present in all cell lines except Riva-I. This variant was previously associated with decreased DNA repair capacity, particularly in combination with other homologous recombination (HR) gene variants.
title: Epigenetic inhibitors sensitize DLBCL cells to rituximab and doxorubicin

finding: The SNP rs4905194 was found to be trans-associated with the gene CPEB2 in the liver, indicating its role in regulating a gene network comprised of 48 causal interactions. This association was significant at a 10% false discovery rate (FDR) and suggested that variations in this SNP influence CBG mRNA expression and potentially plasma cortisol levels.
title: Gene networks driven by genetic variation for plasma cortisol in hepatic and adipose tissues implicate corticosteroid binding globulin in modulating tissue glucocorticoid action and cardiovascular risk

finding: The SNP rs11622665 was associated with RNF13 in subcutaneous fat, forming the largest sub-network with 215 gene targets at a 10% FDR. This trans-association highlighted the influence of cortisol levels on gene regulation within adipose tissue.
title: Gene networks driven by genetic variation for plasma cortisol in hepatic and adipose tissues implicate corticosteroid binding globulin in modulating tissue glucocorticoid action and cardiovascular risk

finding: An association between the SNP rs8022616 and the transcription factor IRF2 was identified in subcutaneous fat. This SNP was linked to a network of 128 genes, with targets that included LDB2 and LIPA, relevant to cardiovascular disease (CVD) pathways.
title: Gene networks driven by genetic variation for plasma cortisol in hepatic and adipose tissues implicate corticosteroid binding globulin in modulating tissue glucocorticoid action and cardiovascular risk

finding: The SNP rs2005945 was found to be linked to both CD163 and LUC7L3 in visceral abdominal fat. Although many associations were found in this tissue, causal interactions remained limited under a 10% FDR.
title: Gene networks driven by genetic variation for plasma cortisol in hepatic and adipose tissues implicate corticosteroid binding globulin in modulating tissue glucocorticoid action and cardiovascular risk

finding: Related to the regulation of ATG14 expression, this SNP was noted as protective and linked to enhancing autophagic processes in individuals with variants.
title: Establishing gene regulatory networks from Parkinson’s disease risk loci

finding: SNP rs28477407, found in miR-4308, exhibited a significant association with RA, indicated by a p-value of 3.44×10^-5.
title: MicroRNA variants and HLA-miRNA interactions are novel rheumatoid arthritis susceptibility factors

finding: The rs8984 variant was associated with an increase in the long transcript isoform of the CHURC1 gene. This alteration was possibly linked to the destruction of a microRNA binding site, impacting gene expression.
title: The genetic determinants of the relative expression of alternative 3’UTR isoforms in human

finding: The SNP rs8023164, linked to multiple sclerosis (MS) and systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE), was found to significantly alter the binding affinity of the transcription factor FOSL2, indicating its potential role in regulating Th17 responses.
title: The AP-1 factors FOSL1 and FOSL2 co-regulate human Th17 responses

finding: The SNP rs17103360, associated with MS and rheumatoid arthritis (RA), exhibited changes that affected the binding of FOSL2, suggesting that it influences Th17 cell identity.
title: The AP-1 factors FOSL1 and FOSL2 co-regulate human Th17 responses

finding: The variant rs1056879 was identified as having a negative effect size on the expression of the gene PPP2R3C within a locus associated with PAU. This variant was associated with lower expression of PPP2R3C in oligodendrocytes, D1/D2 medium spiny neurons (MSNs), and fast-spiking interneurons, suggesting its relevance to alcohol use disorder (AUD) and a potential protective role of PPP2R3C in relation to AUD.
title: Integrated Single-Cell Multiomic Profiling of Caudate Nucleus Suggests Key Mechanisms in Alcohol Use Disorder

finding: The SNP rs75418419 in the SNAPC1 gene was identified as having a significant association with suicide death. It was one of the five novel, high-impact, rare SNPs found in the study, and was present in 119 of the 2,672 suicide cases analyzed, indicating its potential role in the genetic risk for suicide.
title: Rare protein coding variants implicate genes involved in risk of suicide death

finding: The rs12432539 variant was significantly associated with the strength of activation in both the R-VTA (P = 0.0155) and R-NAc (P = 0.0052), pointing to its involvement in the endosomal sorting processes relevant to the reward system. This synonymous variant impacts the SNX6 gene.
title: Gene Set-Based Analysis of the Endosomal Sorting Processes Cargo Selection and Membrane Tubulation with Human Reward System Reactivity

finding: The study investigated the impact of the rs8005161 polymorphism on G protein-coupled receptor GPR65 (also known as TDAG8) activation associated with pH changes in intestinal inflammation. The results indicated that this SNP influenced the receptor's sensitivity to pH levels, contributing to inflammatory responses in intestinal tissues.
title: Activation of the proton-sensing GPCR, GPR65 on fibroblast-like synoviocytes contributes to inflammatory joint pain

finding: The SNP rs160459 was significantly associated with the depth of the left superior temporal asymmetrical pit (STAP) in the discovery sample from the UK Biobank (N=16,515), with a p-value of 4.2×10^-12. This association was replicated in different cohorts and was linked to variations in several phenotypes related to the auditory/linguistic network. Notably, it impacted the gray matter volume, thickness, and surface areas of the left STAP and surrounding areas.
title: Enhancer locus in ch14q23.1 modulates brain asymmetric temporal regions involved in language processing

finding: The SNP rs1957757 in the HIF-1alpha gene showed a significant interaction with CpG island methylation in the promoter region, which was associated with the increased risk of anti-tuberculosis drug-induced liver injury in humans. This finding underscored the genetic predisposition related to hepatotoxicity due to isoniazid (INH) treatment, highlighting the potential role of this polymorphism in assessing susceptibility to liver damage during tuberculosis therapy.
title: Endoplasmic reticulum stress inhibition preserves mitochondrial function and cell survival during early onset of isoniazid-induced oxidative stress

finding: The SNP rs8005161 was reported to be associated with the G protein-coupled receptor GPR65 (also known as TDAG8). This polymorphism was shown to impact pH-associated activation of the receptor during intestinal inflammation, indicating its potential role in modulating inflammatory responses. The context relates to respiratory complications, as the GPR65 receptor may also have relevance in the signaling pathways involved in the inflammation observed in conditions like acute lung injury and acute respiratory distress syndrome.
title: Activation of a nerve injury transcriptional signature in airway-innervating sensory neurons after LPS induced lung inflammation

finding: The SNP rs3087918 was associated with a decreased breast cancer risk in a Chinese population, according to a case-control study conducted by Zheng et al. This finding was significant and highlighted the potential of LncRNA MEG3 in influencing breast cancer predisposition.
title: Chameleon microRNAs in breast cancer: their elusive role as regulatory factors in cancer progression

finding: A positive association was established between the SNP rs1046117 in the FOS gene and nonsyndromic cleft lip and palate (NSCLP). This finding was identified through RNA-seq analysis, which revealed differential expression of fosab (the zebrafish homologue of FOS) in embryos, supporting the hypothesis that FOS is a novel candidate gene for NSCLP.
title: Disruption of fos causes craniofacial anomalies in developing zebrafish

finding: The H3309R substitution in nesprin-2 was associated with Emery-Dreifuss muscular dystrophy and correlated with the expression of the tumor suppressor CDK1/p21 in HBV-related hepatocellular carcinomas.
title: Peptide Ancestry Informative Markers in Uterine Neoplasms from Women of European, African and Asian Ancestry
